original: Moggallāna vuttivivaraṇapañcikā.
translated: The five-hundred-line commentary on the analysis of the verbal roots.

original: Vuttisametā.
analyzed: vutti sametā
translated: The verbal roots are complete.

original: Namo tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: Homage to the Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Rightly Self-awakened One

original: Saddhamiddhaguṇaṃ sādhu namassitvā tathāgataṃ,
analyzed: saddham iddha guṇam sādhu namassitvā tathāgatam
translated: Having well paid homage to the Realised One, who has the virtue of the True Dhamma,

original: Sadhammasaṅghaṃ bhāsissaṃ māgadhaṃ saddalakkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: sa dhamma saṅgham bhāsissam māgadham sadda lakkhaṇam
translated: I will speak about the True Dhamma, the Community, and the Magadhan characteristics.

original: Akārādayo niggahītantā tecattālīsakkharā vaṇṇā nāma honti, a ā i ī u ū e ऐ o औ ka
analyzed: akāra ādayaḥ niggahī tantā vaṇṇāḥ nāma honti ka
translated: The vowels are the forty-three phonemes beginning with the vowel a, namely: a ā i ī u ū e ai o au ka

original: kha ga gha ṅa ca cha ja jha ña ṭa ṭha ḍa ḍha ṇa ta tha da dha na pa pha ba bha ma
analyzed: kha ga gha ṅa ca cha ja jha ña ṭa ṭha ḍa ḍha ṇa ta tha da dha na pa pha ba bha ma
translated: kha ga gha ṅa ca cha ja jha ña ṭa ṭha ḍa ḍha ṇa ta tha da dha na pa pha ba bha ma

original: ya ra la va sa ha ḷa aṃ; tena kvattho “ñonama vaṇṇe“. titālīsāti vacanaṃ katthavi
analyzed: ya ra la va sa ha ḷa am tena kvatthaḥ ña ūnama vaṇṇe ti tālīsā ati vacanam katthavi
translated: ya ra la va sa ha ḷa aṃ; therefore the statement “The vowels are called non-nasals” is made.

original: vaṇṇalopaṃ ñāpeti; tena-paṭisaṅkhāyoni soti-ādi siddhaṃ.
analyzed: vaṇṇa lopam ñāpa iti siddham
translated: The statement “The vowels are forty” informs of the omission of the vowels; therefore “so” and so on are established by reasoning.

original: Dasādo sarā-.
analyzed: sarā
translated: The ten vowels are long.

original: Tatthādimhi dasa vaṇṇā sarā nāma honti; tena kvattho “saro lopo sare“. ccādi.
analyzed: tattha ādimhi dasa vaṇṇāḥ sarāḥ nāma honti tena kvatthaḥ saraḥ lopo sare cca ādi
translated: Therein, the ten vowels beginning with a are called long; therefore the statement “The long vowel is omitted in a long vowel” is made.

original: Dvedve savaṇṇā-.
analyzed: dve dve savaṇṇā
translated: The two vowels are short.

original: Tesu dvedve sarā savaṇṇā nāma honti; tena kvattho “vaṇṇapareṇa savaṇṇopi“
analyzed: tesu dve dve sarā savaṇṇāḥ nāma honti tena kvatthaḥ vaṇṇa pareṇa savaṇṇaḥ api
translated: Among them, the two vowels are called short; therefore the statement “The short vowel is also a vowel when preceded by a vowel” is made.

original: Pubbo rasso-.
analyzed: pubbaḥ rassaḥ
translated: The nasal is a mora.

original: Tesu dvīsu yo yo pubbo so so rassasañño hoti; tesu e o saṃyogato pubbāva dissanti; tena kvattho “rasso ve“.ccādi.
analyzed: tesu dvīsu yaḥ yaḥ pubbaḥ saḥ saḥ rassa sañño hoti tesu e o saṃyogato pubbā ava dissanti tena kvatthaḥ rassaḥ
translated: Of these two, the first is the idea of short, and the second is the idea of long. Of these two, the e and the o are seen to be the same as the a, which is the first. Therefore the kvatha is “rasso ve” , etc.

original: Paro dīgho-.
analyzed: paraḥ dīghaḥ
translated: The other is long.

original: Tesveva dvīsu yo yo paro so so dīghasañño hoti; tena kvattho’yolopanisu dīgho“.ccādi.
analyzed: tesu eva dvīsu yaḥ yaḥ paraḥ saḥ saḥ dīgha saññaḥ hoti tena kvattha yo lopanisu dīgha ucca ādi
translated: Of these two, the second is the idea of long. Therefore the kvatha is “yolopanisu dīgho” , etc.

original: Kādayo byajanā-.
analyzed: ka ādayaḥ byajanā
translated: The ka, etc., are the consonants.

original: Kakārādayo vaṇṇā niggahītapariyantā byajanasaññā honti; tena kvattho “byajane dīgharassā“.ccādi.
analyzed: kakāra ādayaḥ vaṇṇāḥ niggahīta pariyantāḥ byajana saññāḥ honti tena kvatthaḥ byajane dīgha rassa a c ca ādi
translated: The vowels beginning with the ka, etc., and ending with the niggahīta are the idea of consonants. Therefore the kvatha is “byajane dīgharassā” , etc.

original: Pañca pañcakā vaggā-.
analyzed: pañca pañcakā vaggā
translated: The five sets of five are the groups.

original: Kādayo pañcakā pañca vaggā nāma hontī; tena kvattho “vagge vagganto“. ccādi.
analyzed: ka ādayaḥ pañcakā pañca vaggāḥ nāma honti tena ku atthaḥ vagge vagga antaḥ cca ādi
translated: The five sets of five beginning with the ka are called the groups. Therefore the kvatha is “vagge vagganto” , etc.

original: Bindu niggahītaṃ-.
analyzed: bindu niggahītam
translated: The drop is the niggahīta.

original: Yvāyaṃ vaṇṇe bindumatto so niggahītasañño hoti; tena kvattho “niggahītami“. ccādi; garusaññā karaṇaṃ anvatthasaññatthaṃ.
analyzed: yvā ayam vaṇṇe bindumatto so niggahīta saññaḥ hoti tena kvattho ccādi garu saññā karaṇam anvattha saññattham
translated: This is the idea of the niggahīta. Therefore the kvatha is “niggahītami” , etc. The idea of heavy is for the purpose of the idea of the following.

original: Iyuvaṇṇā jjhalā nāmassante-.
analyzed: iyu vaṇṇāḥ jjha lāḥ nāmas sante
translated: The iyu vowel is the jhalla at the end of a name.

original: Nāmaṃ pāṭipadikaṃ tassa ante vattamānā ivaṇṇuvaṇṇā jhalasaññā honti yathākkamaṃ; tena kvattho“jhalā ve“. Ccādi.
analyzed: nāmam pāṭipadikam tassa ante vattamānāḥ jha l a saññāḥ honti yathākkamam tena ku attho jha lāḥ ve c c ādi
translated: The name is the beginning, and the vowels occurring at the end of it are the perception of the letter jha in due succession; therefore it is said “jhalā ve” .

original: Pitthiyaṃ-.
analyzed: pitthiyam
translated: On the back.

original: Itthiyaṃ vattamānassa nāmassante vattamānā ivaṇṇu vaṇṇā pasaññā honti; tena kvatthā “ye passivaṇṇassa“. Iccādi.
analyzed: itthiyam vattamānassa vattamānāḥ vaṇṇāḥ pasaññāḥ honti tena kvatthāḥ ye passivaṇṇassa iccādi
translated: The vowels occurring at the end of the name occurring in a woman are the perception of the letter pa; therefore it is said “ye passivaṇṇassa” .

original: Ghā-.
analyzed: ghā
translated: On the nose.

original: Itthiyaṃ vattamānassa nāmassante vattamāno ākāro ghasañeññā hoti; tena kvattho “ghabrahmādite“.Ccādi.
analyzed: itthiyam vattamānassa nāmassa ante vattamānaḥ ākāraḥ gha sañā iññā hoti tena kvatthaḥ gha brahma ādita icca ādi
translated: The mode occurring at the end of the name occurring in a woman is the perception of the letter gha; therefore it is said “ghabrahmādite” .

original: Gosyālapane-.
analyzed: gosya ālapane
translated: In the cow-pen.

original: Ālapane si gasañño hoti; tena kvattho “ge ve“.Ccādi.🔽Saññādhikāro.
analyzed: ālapane si ga saññaḥ hoti tena kvatthaḥ ge ve c ca ādi  saññā adhikāraḥ
translated: In the cow-pen the perception is of the letter ga; therefore it is said “ge ve” .

original: Vidhibbisesanantassa-.
analyzed: vidhip bisesana antassa
translated: The section on perception is ended.🔽The rule is to be known as the distinction of that.

original: Yaṃ visesanaṃ tadantassa vidhi ñātabbo; “ato yonaṃ ṭāṭe“. Narā nare.
analyzed: yam visesanam tad antassa vidhi ñātabbaḥ atas ya ūnam ṭa āṭe narā nare
translated: The distinction is to be known as the rule at the end of it; “ato yonaṃ ṭāṭe” . Narā nare.

original: Sattamiyaṃ pubbassa-.
analyzed: sattamiyam pubbassa
translated: The seventh is the preceding.

original: Sattamīniddese pubbasseva kāriyaṃ ñatabbaṃ; “saro lopo sare“. Veḷaggaṃ; tamahantīdha kasmā na hoti; saretopasilesikādhāro tatthetāva vuccate pubbasseva hoti na parassāti.
analyzed: sattamī niddese pubbassa iva kāriyam ñatabbam saraḥ lopaḥ sare veḷaggam tam ahanti idha kasmā na hoti tattha iti ava vuccate pubbassa iva hoti na parassa ati
translated: In the seventh case, the same should be known as in the first case: “saro lopo sare”. Veḷaggaṃ; why is it not here? In the first case, the basis of the minor fault of elision is said to be just that.

original: Pañcamiyaṃ parassa-.
analyzed: pañcamiyam parassa
translated: In the fifth case, the same should be known as in the second case.🔽In the fifth case, the same should be known as in the second case: “ato yonaṃ ṭāṭe”. Narā nare; here it is not: jantuyo anantā; here why is it not? osadhyo anantare katatthatāya na vyava hitassa kāriyaṃ.

original: Pañcamīniddese parassa kāriyaṃ ñatabbaṃ; “ato yonaṃ ṭāṭe“. Narā nare; idha na hoti jantuyo anantā; idha kasmā na hoti; osadhyo anantare katatthatāya na vyava hitassa kāriyaṃ.🔽Ādissa-.
analyzed: pañcamī niddese parassa kāriyam a taḥ ya ūnam ṭāṭe narā nare idha na hoti jantuyaḥ anantāḥ idha kasmā na hoti osadhyaḥ anantare katatthatāya na vyava hitassa kāriyam  ādissa
translated: In the sixth case, the same should be known as in the first case.

original: Parassa sissamānaṃ kāriyamādivaṇṇassa ñātabbaṃ; “ra saṅkhyāto vā“. Rājinā.
analyzed: parassa sissamānam kāriyam ādi vaṇṇassa ñātabbam ra saṅkhyātaḥ vā rājinā
translated: In the sixth case, the same should be known as in the first case: “ra saṅkhyāto vā”. Rājinā.

original: Chaṭṭhiyantassa-.
analyzed: chaṭṭhiyantassa
translated: In the seventh case, the same should be known as in the second case.🔽In the seventh case, the same should be known as in the second case: “rājassi nāmhi”. Rājinā.

original: Chaṭṭhiniddiṭṭhassa yaṃ kāriyaṃ tadantassa vaṇṇassa viññeyyaṃ “rājassi nāmhi“. Rājinā.🔽Ṅanubandho-.
analyzed: chaṭṭhi niddiṭṭhassa yam kāriyam tad antassa vaṇṇassa viññeyyam rājassi nāmhi rājinā  ṅ anubandhaḥ
translated: In the eighth case, the same should be known as in the third case.

original: Ṅakāro’nubandho yassa so’ntassa hoti; “gossāvaṅi“. Gavāssaṃ.
analyzed: ṅakāraḥ anubandhaḥ yassa so ntassa hoti gossa avaṅi gavāssam
translated: In the eighth case, the same should be known as in the third case: “gossāvaṅi”. Gavāssaṃ.🔽In the ninth case, the same should be known as in the fourth case.

original: Ṭanubandhānekavaṇṇā sabbassa-.
analyzed: ṭ anubandhā aneka vaṇṇā sabbassa
translated: In the ninth case, the same should be known as in the fourth case: “sabbasmiṃ”.

original: Ṭakāro’nubandho yassa so’nekakkharo cādeso sabbassa hoti; “imassānitthiyaṃ ṭe“. Esu “nāmhanimi“. Anena.
analyzed: ṭakāraḥ anubandhaḥ yassa saḥ neka kkharaḥ ca ādesaḥ sabbassa hoti ṭe esu anena
translated: In these words “nāmhanimi” .

original: Ñakānubandhādyantā-.
analyzed: ñaka anubandha ādi antā
translated: By this .

original: Chaṭṭhiniddiṭṭhassa ñānubandhakānubandhā ādyantā honti; “bruto tissīña“. Bravīti, “bhussa vuka“. Babhuva.🔽Manubandho sarānamantā paro-.
analyzed: chaṭṭhi niddiṭṭhassa ña anubandhaka anubandhāḥ ādi antāḥ honti bravīti bhussa babhuva  manubandho paras
translated: The letter ñ is a suffix, and the vowel of the preceding syllable is lengthened at the beginning and end: “bruto tissīña” . Bravīti, “bhussa vuka” . Babhuva.

original: Makāro’nubandho yassa so sarānamantā sarā paro hotī; “mañca rudhādīnaṃ“. Rundhati.
analyzed: makāraḥ anubandhaḥ yassa saḥ sarā anamantā sarā paras
translated: The letter m is a suffix, and the vowel of the preceding syllable is lengthened at the end: “mañca rudhādīnaṃ” . Rundhati.

original: Vippaṭisedhe-.
analyzed: vippaṭisedhe
translated: In the case of the prohibition .

original: Dvinnaṃ tiṇṇaṃ vā purisānaṃ sahappattiyaṃ paro; so ca gacchati tvañca gacchasi, tumhe gacchatha; so ca gacchati tvañca gacchasi ahañca gacchāmi, mayaṃ gacchāma.
analyzed: dvinnam tiṇṇam vā purisānam sahappattiyam paras saḥ ca gacchati tvam ca gacchasi tumhe gacchatha saḥ ca gacchati tvam ca gacchasi aham ca gacchāmi mayam gacchāma
translated: When two or three men are together, the form is in the plural: “So ca gacchati tvañca gacchasi, tumhe gacchatha; so ca gacchati tvañca gacchasi ahañca gacchāmi, mayaṃ gacchāma.” .

original: Saṅketo’navayavo’nubandho-.
analyzed: saṅketaḥ ūna avayavaḥ unubandho
translated: The convention is a suffix without a component .

original: Yo’navayavabhuto saṅketo so’nubandhoti ñatabbo;latupitādīnamāsimhi. Kattā, saṅketaggahaṇaṃ
analyzed: saṅketaḥ saṅketaḥ saṅketa ggahaṇam
translated: It should be understood that a convention without a component is a suffix: “latupitādīnamāsimhi” . Kattā, the mention of the convention

original: kiṃ? Pakatīyādisamudāyassānubandhatā mā hotuti; anavayavo hi samudāyo samudāyarūpattāyeva;
analyzed: kim pakatīya ādi samudāyaḥ sa anubandha tā mā an avayavaḥ hi samudāyaḥ samudāya rūpa ttāya iva
translated: What? Let there not be the inclusion of the collection of the ordinary and so on; for a collection is not a component part, because of its being a collection-form.

original: anavayavaggahaṇaṃ kiṃ?’Atena’. Janena; imināva lopassāvagatattā nānubandhalopāya vacanamāraddhaṃ.
analyzed: an avayava ggahaṇam kiṃatena janena na anubandha lopāya vacanam āraddham
translated: What is the point of the mention of ‘not a component part’? ‘By this’ person; because of the understanding of the omission by this very (word), the statement is not established for the omission of the inclusion.

original: Vaṇṇaparena savaṇṇo’pi-.
analyzed: vaṇṇa parena sa vaṇṇaḥ api
translated: With the addition of the word ‘colour’ even ‘all colour’ is (included).

original: Vaṇṇasaddo paro yasmā tena savaṇṇo’pi gayhati saṃva rūpaṃ; yuvaṇṇānamño luttā“. Vāteritaṃ, samonā.🔽Ntu vantumanatvāvantutavantusambandhi-.🔽Vantvādisambandhiyeva ntu gayhati, “ntantunaṃ nto yomhi paṭhame“. Guṇavanto; vantvādisambandhīti kiṃ; jantu tantu.🔽Paribhāsāyo.🔽Saro lopo sare-.
analyzed: vaṇṇa saddo paraḥ yasmā tena savaṇṇaḥ api rūpam luttā vāta īritam             paṭhame guṇavantaḥ tantu  paribhāsāyo  saraḥ lopaḥ sare
translated: Because the word ‘colour’ is added, even ‘all colour’ is included, ‘all colour’ is form; ‘all colours’ is the case of the feminine.

original: Sare saro lopanīyo hoti; tatrime, saddhindriyaṃ, no hetaṃ, bhikkhunovādo, sametāyasmā, abhibhāyatanaṃ, puttā matthi, asantettha.
analyzed: sare saraḥ lopanīyaḥ hoti tatra ime saddhi indriyam no ha itam bhikkhunā uvādaḥ sameta ayasmai puttāḥ asantā ittha
translated: ‘Ntu’ is used for ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vantu’ and ‘vant

original: Paro kvaci lopanīyo hoti; so’pi, sāva, yatodakaṃ, tatova; kvavīti kiṃ? Saddhinduyaṃ ayamadhikāro āparicchedāvasānā tena nātippasaṅgo.
analyzed: paraḥ kvaci lopanīyaḥ hoti saḥ api yatas udakam tatas uva kvavi iti kim ayam adhikāraḥ tena na ati pasaṅgo
translated: is sometimes dropped; and that too, O bird, from where there is water, from there. What is the use of kvaci? In the Saddavindu this topic ends with the section on āpariccheda, therefore there is no excess.

original: Nadvevā-.
analyzed: na tu eva
translated: Not in the two.

original: Pubbaparasarā dve’pi vā kvaci na lupyante; latā iva lateva latāva.
analyzed: dve api vā kvaci na lupyante latāḥ iva latā iva latā ava
translated: In the two, beginning and end, are not dropped in some cases; latā iva, lateva, latāva.

original: Yuvaṇṇanamño luttā-.
analyzed: yu va ṇ a nam ñaḥ luttā
translated: The ṇo of the praise of the young man is dropped.

original: Luttā sarā paresaṃ ivaṇṇuvaṇṇānaṃ ño honti vā yathākkamaṃ; tassedaṃ, vāteritaṃ, nopeti,
analyzed: luttā sarā paresam ñaḥ honti vā yathākkamam tassa idam vāta īritam na upeti
translated: The ṇo of the praise of others is dropped, and the ṇo of the praise of the young man is sometimes dropped, according to the color; tassedaṃ, vāteritaṃ, nopeti,

original: vāmoru, ateva’ññe, vodakaṃ; kathaṃ paccorasmanti; yogavibhagā, vātveva tassidaṃ;
analyzed: vāma ūru atevaññe vā udakam katham yogavibhagāḥ tassa idam
translated: vāmoru, ateva’ññe, vodakaṃ; how is it paccorasmanti; yogavibhagā, vātveva tassidaṃ;

original: lutteti kiṃ? Latā iva.
analyzed: luttā iti kim latāḥ iva
translated: What is the use of lutteti? Latā iva.

original: Yavā sare-.
analyzed: yavā sare
translated: The ya of the two is changed.

original: Sare pare ivaṇṇuvaṇṇānaṃ yakāravakārā hontiva yathākkamaṃ; vyākato, iccassa, ajjhiṇamutto, svāgataṃ, bhavāpanalānīlaṃ; vāttheva-itissa; kvacītveva-yānīdha, sūpaṭṭhitaṃ.
analyzed: sare pare yakāra vakārāḥ yathākkamam yathākkamam su upaṭṭhitam
translated: The ya and va of the two are changed to ka and ka respectively, according to the color of others; vyākato, iccassa, ajjhiṇamutto, svāgataṃ, bhavāpanalānīlaṃ; vāttheva-itissa; kvacītveva-yānīdha, sūpaṭṭhitaṃ.

original: Ñonaṃ-.
analyzed: ña ūnam
translated: The ṇo of the two.

original: Ñonaṃ yavā honti vā sare yathākkamaṃ; tyajja te’jja svāhaṃ so’haṃ,kvacitveva-puttāmatthi asantettha.
analyzed: ñonam yavāḥ honti vā sare yathākkamam tyajja tejja svāham asantā ittha
translated: The words yavā, honti, vā, sare, yathā, kkamaṃ, tyajja, te, ’jja, svāhaṃ, so, ’haṃ, kvacit, eva, puttā, matthi, asante, ttha.

original: Gossāvaṅi-.
analyzed: goḥ sāvaṅi
translated: Gossāvaṅi-.

original: Sare gossa avaṅi hoti; gavāssaṃ; yathariva tatharivetinipātāva; bhusāmiveti ivasaddo evattho.
analyzed: sare gossa avaṅi hoti gavāssam bhusām iva iti iva saddaḥ eva atthaḥ
translated: The word avaṅi is in the genitive case of the word go; gavāssaṃ; yathariva, tatharivetinipātāva; bhusāmiveti ivasaddo evattho.

original: Byañjane dīgharassā-.
analyzed: byañjane dīgha ras sā
translated: Byañjane dīgharassā-.

original: Rassadīghānaṃ kvaci dīgharassā honti byañjane; tatrāyaṃ, munīvare, sammadeva, mālahārī.
analyzed: rassa dīghānam kvaci dīgha rassāḥ honti byañjane tatra ayam muni vare sammadā iva māla hārī
translated: In some cases the long and short vowels are lengthened and shortened in the consonants; tatrāyaṃ, munīvare, sammadeva, mālahārī.

original: Saramhā dve-
analyzed: saramhā dve
translated: Saramhā dve-

original: Saramhā parassa byañjanassa kvaci dve rūpā honti; paggaho; saramhāti-kiṃ? Taṃkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: saramhā parassa byañjanassa kvaci dve rūpāḥ honti paggahaḥ taṃ khaṇam
translated: In some cases, from saram, two forms of the other consonant are made; paggaho; saramhāti-kiṃ? Taṃkhaṇaṃ.

original: Catutthadutiyesveyaṃ tatiyapaṭhāmā-.
analyzed: catuttha dutiyesu iyam tatiya paṭhāmā
translated: Catutthadutiyesveyaṃ tatiyapaṭhāmā-.

original: Catutthadutiyesu paresvesaṃ catutthadutiyānaṃ tabbagge tatiyapaṭhamā honti paccāsattya; mahaddhano, yasa tthero, apphuṭaṃ, abbhuggato; esviti-kiṃ? Thero; esantikiṃ?Pattho.
analyzed: catuttha dutiyesu paresu esam catuttha dutiyānam tad bagge tatiya paṭhamāḥ honti mahat dhanaḥ ttheraḥ apphuṭam abbhuggataḥ thero
translated: In the other fourth and second, the fourth and second of these have the third and first in their own group, in the reverse order; mahaddhano, yasa tthero, apphuṭaṃ, abbhuggato; esviti-kiṃ? Thero; esantikiṃ?Pattho.

original: Vitisseve vā-.
analyzed: vi tis seve vā
translated: Vitisseve vā-.

original: Evasadde pare itissa vo hoti vā; ittheva icceva; eveti-kiṃ,iccāha.🔽Ñonama vaṇṇe-.
analyzed: eva sadde pare itissa vaḥ hoti vā itthā iva icca iva eva iti kiṃicca āha  ñaḥ nama vaṇṇe
translated: The particle va is used in the sense of ‘sometimes’ and ‘sometimes not’.

original: Ñonaṃ vaṇṇe kvaci a hoti vā; disvā yācakamāgate, akarambhasate,esaattho, esadhammo,
analyzed: ña ūnam vaṇṇe kvaci a hoti vā disvā yācakam āgate a karambha sate esa atthaḥ esa dhammaḥ
translated: The particle a is used in the sense of ‘having seen’ and ‘having come’; ‘having come to the beggar’, ‘having a hundred opportunities’, ‘this is the meaning’, ‘this is the Dhamma’,

original: maggo aggamakkhāyati, svāyatanaṃ, hiyyattanaṃ, karassu; vātveva-yācake āgate, eso🔽dhammo; vaṇṇeti kiṃ?So.
analyzed: maggaḥ aggam akkhāyati su āyatanam hiyyattanam karassu vātveva yācake āgate eso  dhammaḥ vaṇṇeti kiṃso
translated: ‘the path is proclaimed as the best’, ‘one’s own abode’, ‘one’s own person’, ‘you should do’; ‘having come to the beggar’, ‘this is the Dhamma’,

original: Niggahītaṃ-.
analyzed: niggahītam
translated: ‘this is the praise’.🔽The particle niggahīta is used in the sense of ‘having been restrained’.

original: Niggabhītamāgamo hoti vā kvaci; cakkhuṃ udapādi cakkhu udapādi, purimaṃjāti purimajāti,
analyzed: niggabhīta māgamaḥ hoti vā kvaci cakkhum udapādi cakkhu udapādi purimaṃjāti purima jāti
translated: The particle ā is used in the sense of ‘having arisen’; ‘the eye arose’, ‘the eye arose’, ‘the former birth’, ‘the former births’,

original: kattabbaṃ kusalaṃ bahuṃ. Avaṃ siroti-ādisu niccaṃ vavatthītavibhāsattā vādhikārassa;
analyzed: kattabbam kusalam bahum avam sirā uti ādisu niccam vā adhikārassa
translated: ‘what should be done is much good’. In the words avaṃ siroti, etc., the particle va is always used in the sense of ‘restraint’ and ‘distinction’ because of the authority of the text;

original: sāmatthī yenāgamova sa ca rassasarasseva hoti tassa rassānugatattā.🔽Lopo-.🔽Niggahītassa lopo hoti vā kvaci; kyāhaṃ kīmahaṃ, sā ratto saṃratto; sallekho-gattukāmo-gantumanotiādisu niccaṃ.
analyzed: sāmatthī sa ca hoti tassa  lopaḥ  niggahītassa lopaḥ hoti vā kvaci kyā aham kīm aham sā ratto saṃratto sat lekhaḥ gattu kāmaḥ gantu mano ti ādisu niccam
translated: and that is because the particle ā is used only in the sense of ‘having arisen’ and is always connected with the word ‘arisen’ because of its connection with the word ‘arisen’.🔽The particle lopa is used in the sense of ‘having been restrained’.

original: Parasarassa-
analyzed: para sarassa
translated: The particle lopa is used in the sense of ‘having been restrained’; ‘what am I?’, ‘what shall I do?’, ‘he is attached’, ‘he is devoted’; ‘having gone out’, ‘desiring to go’, ‘desiring to go’ and so on, it is always used.

original: Niggahītamhā parassa sarassa lopo hoti vā kvaci; tvaṃsi tvamasi.
analyzed: niggahītamhā parassa sarassa lopaḥ hoti vā kvaci tvam si tvam asi
translated: The elision of the vowel of the preceding syllable takes place in niggahīta, or sometimes not; tvaṃsi, tvamasi.

original: Vagge vagganto-
analyzed: vagge vagga antaḥ
translated: In a section, a section-ending

original: Niggahītassa kho vagge vagganto vā hoti paccā satyā; taṅkaroti taṃ karoti, tañcarati
analyzed: niggahītassa kho vagge vaggantaḥ vā hoti paccā satyā tam karoti tam karoti tam carati
translated: In a section, a section-ending takes place in niggahīta, or after the first syllable; taṅkaroti, taṃ karoti, tañcarati

original: taṃ carati, taṇṭhānaṃ taṃ ṭhānaṃ, tandhanaṃ taṃ dhanaṃ, tampāti taṃ pāti; niccaṃ
analyzed: tam carati tat ṭhānam tat ṭhānam tat dhanam tam dhanam tam pāti tam pāti niccam
translated: taṃ carati, taṇṭhānaṃ, taṃ ṭhānaṃ, tandhanaṃ, taṃ dhanaṃ, tampāti, taṃ pāti; niccaṃ

original: pada majjhe, gantvā; kvacaññatrāpi, santiṭṭhati.
analyzed: pada majjhe gantvā kvaca aññatra api santiṭṭhati
translated: in the middle of a word, having gone; sometimes elsewhere also, stands.

original: Yevahisuñño-.
analyzed: yeva hi suññaḥ
translated: Yevahi, suñño-.

original: Yaevahisaddesu niggahītassa vā ño hoti; yayaññadeva, taññeva, tañbhi; vātveva-yaṃyadeva.
analyzed: ya eva hi saddesu niggahītassa vā ñaḥ hoti taññeva tañbhi
translated: In yevahi, the vowel of the preceding syllable is elided in niggahīta, or ño; yayaññadeva, taññeva, taṃbhi; vātveva-yaṃyadeva.

original: Ye saṃssa-
analyzed: ye saṃssa
translated: Ye saṃssa-

original: Saṃsaddassa yaṃ niggahītaṃ tassa vā ño hoti yakāre; saññamo saṃyamo.
analyzed: saṃsaddassa yam niggahītam tassa vā ñaḥ hoti yakāre saññamaḥ saṃyamaḥ
translated: In saṃssa, the vowel of the preceding syllable is elided in niggahīta, or ño, in yaṃ; saññamo, saṃyamo.

original: Mayadā sare-.
analyzed: mayadā sare
translated: Mayadā, sare-.

original: Niggahītassa mayadā honti vā sare kvaci; tamahaṃ, tayidaṃ, tadalaṃ; vātveva-taṃ ahaṃ.
analyzed: niggahītassa maya dāḥ honti vā sare kvacid aham aham
translated: The vowel of the preceding syllable is elided in niggahīta, or mayadā, or sare, sometimes; tamahaṃ, tayidaṃ, tadalaṃ; vātveva-taṃ ahaṃ.

original: Vanataragā cāgamā-.
analyzed: vanatara gā ca āgamā
translated: Vanataragā cāgamā-.

original: Ete mayadā cāgamā honti sare vā kvaci; tivaṅgīkaṃ, ito nāyati, cinitvā, tasmātiha,
analyzed: ete mayadā ca āgamāḥ honti sare vā kvacid itas na āyati cinitvā tasmāt atiha
translated: These mayadā and āgamā are elided in sare, or sometimes; tivaṅgīkaṃ, ito nāyati, cinitvā, tasmātiha,

original: nirojaṃ, puthageva, idhamāhu, yathayidaṃ, attadatthaṃ; vātveva-attatthaṃ; atippago🔽kho tāvāti-paṭhamanto pagasaddova.🔽Chā ḷo-.🔽Chasaddā parassa sarassa ḷakāro āgamo hoti vā; chaḷahaṃ, chaḷāyatanaṃ; vātveva-cha abhiññā.🔽Tadaminādīni-🔽Tadaminādīni sādhūni bhavanti? Taṃ iminā tadaminā, sakiṃ āgāmī sakadāgāmī, ekaṃ idha🔽ahaṃ ekamidāhaṃ, saṃvidhāya avahāro saṃvidāvahāro, vārino vāhako valāhako, jīvanassa🔽mūto jīmūto, chavassa sayanaṃ susānaṃ, uddhaṃ khamassa udukkhalaṃ, pisi tāso pisāco,🔽mahiyaṃ ravatīti mayūro; evamaññepi payoga to’nugantabbā; paresaṃ pisodarādivedaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: nirojam puthak eva attadattham atippago  kho tāva ati paṭhama antaḥ paga saddo va  chā ḷaḥ  cha saddā parassa sarassa ḷakāraḥ āgamaḥ hoti vā chaḷ aham chaḷ āyatanam abhiññā  tad ami nādīni  tadaminā ādīni sādhūni bhavanti tam iminā tadaminā āgāmī sakadāgāmī ekam  aham ekam ida aham saṃvidhāya avahāraḥ saṃvidāvahāraḥ vārinaḥ vāhakaḥ valāhakaḥ jīvanassa  mūtaḥ jīmūtaḥ chavassa sayanam su sānam uddham khamassa udukkhalam pisi tāsaḥ pisācaḥ  mahiyam ravati iti mayūraḥ evam aññe pi paresam daṭṭhabbam
translated: The word nirojaṃ is said to be a synonym for attadatthaṃ, but atippago is better.🔽The word pagasaddova is the first of the words beginning with pagasad.🔽Chā ḷo-.🔽The word chasaddā is a declensional word; the letter ḷ is a suffix; the word chaḷahaṃ is a pronoun; the word chaḷāyatanaṃ is a noun; the word vātveva is a conjunction; the word cha abhiññā is a numeral.🔽Tadaminādīni-🔽Do the words beginning with tadaminā become good? The words taṃ iminā, tadaminā, sakiṃ āgāmī, sakadāgāmī, ekaṃ idha,🔽ahaṃ, ekamidāhaṃ, saṃvidhāya avahāro, saṃvidāvahāro, vārino vāhako, valāhako, jīvanassa,🔽mūto, jīmūto, chavassa sayanaṃ, susānaṃ, uddhaṃ khamassa, udukkhalaṃ, pisi tāso, pisāco,🔽mahiyaṃ ravatīti mayūro; in this way, the usage in other words should be understood; the words beginning with pisodarā should be seen in other languages.🔽🔽
