translated: The forms kammena, kammanā, cammena, cammanā, etc., are derived from kammā, etc., by the addition of ena, or anā.🔽The forms aggissa, daddhissa, bhikkhussa, sayambhussa, etc., are derived from aggī, daddhi, bhikkhu, sayambhu, etc., by the addition of ssa.

original: Ito kvavī sassa ṭānubandheti -()🔽Brahmādisu pāṭhā sassa e ṭānubandho.🔽Nā smāssa-.
analyzed: i taḥ kva vī sassa ṭa anubandhā iti  brahma ādisu pāṭhā sassa e ṭa anubandhaḥ  na sma āssa
translated: The forms aggine, aggismā, daddhine, daddhismā, bhikkhune, bhikkhusmā, sayambhune, sayambhusmā, etc., are derived from aggī, daddhi, bhikkhu, sayambhu, etc., by the addition of ena, smā, or ne, smā.🔽The forms aggī, daddhi, bhikkhu, sayambhu, etc., are derived from aggīna, daddhīna, bhikkhūna, sayambhūna, etc., by the omission of na.🔽The forms aggī, daddhi, bhikkhu, sayambhu, etc., are derived from aggīna, daddhīna, bhikkhūna, sayambhūna, etc., by the omission of na.

original: Jhalato smāssa nā hoti vā; aagginā aggismā daddhinā, daddhismā, bhikkhunā, bhikkhusmā, sayambhunā, sayambhusmā.🔽Lā yonaṃ vo pume-.
analyzed: jha lataḥ sma assa nā hoti vā a agginā aggismā daddhinā daddhismā bhikkhunā bhikkhusmā sayambhunā sayambhusmā  lā yonam vaḥ pume
translated: The forms aggī, daddhi, bhikkhu, sayambhu, etc., are derived from aggīna, daddhīna, bhikkhūna, sayambhūna, etc., by the omission of na.

original: Lato yonaṃ vo hoti vā palliṅge; bhikkhavo, bhikkhū, sayambhuvo, sayambhu–-pumeti-kiṃ?Āyūni.
analyzed: la taḥ yonam vaḥ hoti vā pad liṅge bhikkhavaḥ bhikkhū
translated: The forms bhikkhavo, bhikkhū, sayambhuvo, sayambhu, etc., are derived from bhikkhu, sayambhu, etc., by the addition of vo, or ū.

original: Janatvādito no ca-.
analyzed: jana tvāt itas na u ca
translated: After janatā, etc., and not after jantvā, etc.

original: Jantvādito yonaṃ no hoti vo ca vā pulliṅge; jantuno, jantavo, jantuyo, gotrabhuno, gotrabhuvo, gotrabhaa, sahabhuno, sahabhuvo, sahabhu.
analyzed: jantu āditaḥ no ca vā pulliṅge jantunaḥ jantavaḥ gotrabhunaḥ gotrabhuvaḥ gotrabhaa sahabhunaḥ sahabhuvaḥ sahabhu
translated: After jantvā, etc., it is not in the feminine, nor in the neuter; jantuno, jantavo, jantuyo, gotrabhuno, gotrabhuvo, gotrabhā, sahabhuno, sahabhuvo, sahabhu.

original: Kuto-.
analyzed: kutas
translated: After kuto.

original: Kuppaccayantato yonaṃ no vā hoti pulliṅge; viduno, vidū, viññuno, viñña, sabbaññuno, sabbañña.
analyzed: kup paccaya antataḥ yonam naḥ vā hoti pul liṅge vidunaḥ vidū viññunaḥ viñña sabbaññunaḥ sabbañña
translated: After kuto, after yonaṃ, it is not in the feminine; viduno, vidū, viññuno, viñña, sabbaññuno, sabbañña.

original: Lopo’musmā-.
analyzed: lopaḥ musmā
translated: The elision of amu in amusmā.

original: Amusaddato yonaṃ lopova hoti pulliṅge; amū pumetveva-amuyo,amūni; vo’pavādā’yaṃ.
analyzed: pul liṅge amū pum etva amuyo amūni
translated: After amusmā, the elision of o is optionally in the feminine; amū, amū, amuyā.

original: Na no sassa-.
analyzed: na naḥ sassa
translated: Na no sassa.

original: Amusmā sassa no na hoti; amussa, noti-kiṃ? Amuyā.
analyzed: amusmā sassa no na hoti amussa notikim amuyā
translated: After amusmā, sassa no is not; amussa, noti-kiṃ? Amuyā.

original: Yolopanisu dīgho-.
analyzed: yaḥ lopa nisu dīghaḥ
translated: Yolopanisu dīgho.

original: Yonaṃ lope nisuva dīgho hoti; aṭṭhi, aṭṭhīni; yolopa nisūti-kiṃ? Rattiyo.
analyzed: yonam lope nisuva dīghaḥ hoti aṭṭhi aṭṭhīni yo lopa nisūtikim
translated: After yonaṃ, after lopa, after nisū, dīgho is; aṭṭhi, aṭṭhīni; yolopa nisūti-kiṃ? Rattiyo.

original: Sunaṃhisu-.
analyzed: sunaṃhisu
translated: Sunaṃhisu.

original: Esu nāmassa dīgho hoti; aggīsu, aggīnaṃ, aggīhani.
analyzed: esu nāmassa dīghaḥ hoti aggīsu aggīnam aggīhani
translated: After esu, after nāma, dīgho is; aggīsu, aggīnaṃ, aggīhani.

original: Pañcādīnaṃ cuddasannama-.
analyzed: pañca ādīnam cud dasan nama
translated: Pañcādīnaṃ cuddasannama.

original: Pañcādīnaṃ vaddasannaṃ sunaṃhisva hoti; pañcasu, pañcannaṃ, pañcahi, chasu, channa, chahi; evaṃ yāva aṭṭhārasā.
analyzed: hoti pañcasu pañcannam pañcahi chasu channa chahi evam yāva aṭṭhārasā
translated: The Genitive case of the five, etc., is sunaṃ, hisva, hoti; in the five, of the five, by the five; in the six, of the six, by the six; and so on up to eighteen.

original: Yavādo ntussa-.
analyzed: yava ādaḥ ntus sa
translated: In the Yavakasaṅkhyā the nt is a.

original: Yavādisu ntussa a hoti; guṇavantā, guṇavantaṃ, guṇavante, guṇavantena, iccādi–-yvādoti-kiṃ? Guṇavā tiṭṭhati. Amussā-ma.
analyzed: yava ādisu n tussa a hoti guṇavantā guṇavantam guṇavante guṇavantena guṇavā tiṭṭhati amussāma
translated: In the Yavakasaṅkhyā the nt is a, when the nt is not followed by a vowel; guṇavantā, guṇavantaṃ, guṇavante, guṇavantena, etc. —What is the omission? Guṇavā tiṭṭhati.

original: Ntassa ca ṭa vaṃse-.🔽Aṃsesu ntappaccayayassa ṭa hoti vā ntussa ci;’ yaṃ yaṃ hirāja bhajati sataṃ vā yadi🔽vā asaṃ” kiccāni kubbassa kareyya kiccaṃ”himavaṃca pabbataṃ’,’sujāti manto’pi ajātimassa’
analyzed: n tassa ca ṭa va ṃse  aṃsesu n tap paccaya yassa ṭa hoti vā n tussa ci yam yam bhajati satam vā yadi  vā asam kiccāni kubbassa kareyya pabbatam su jāti a jāti massa
translated: The nt is a, and the ṭa is a, in the Vaṃsa.

original: yogavibhāgenāññatrāpi’cakkhumā andhitā honti” vaggumudātīriyā pana bhikkhū vaṇṇavā honti.’
analyzed: yoga vibhāgena aññatra api cakkhumā andhitāḥ honti vaggumudātīriyāḥ pana bhikkhū vaṇṇavāḥ honti
translated: In the Aṃsa the nt is a, and the ṭa is a, or the nt is ci, when the nt is not followed by a vowel; yaṃ yaṃ hirāja bhajati sataṃ vā yadi vā asaṃ, kiccāni kubbassa kareyya kiccaṃ, himavaṃca pabbataṃ, sujāti manto pi ajātimassa, yogavibhāgena aññatrā pi cakkhumā andhitā honti, vaggumudātīriyā pana bhikkhū vaṇṇavā honti.

original: Yosujjhissa pume-.
analyzed: yosujjhissa pume
translated: The nt is a, and the pu is a, in the Yosujjhissa.

original: Jhasaññassa issa yosu vā ṭa hoti pulliṅge;aggaso aggī–-jhaggahaṇaṃ kiṃ? Ikārantasamudāyassa ṭo mā siyātirattiyo; iggahaṇaṃ kiṃ? Daṇḍino; puveti-kiṃ; aṭṭhi.🔽Vevosu lussa-.
analyzed: jha saññassa i ssa yosu vā ṭa hoti pul liṅge aggasaḥ i kāra anta samudāyassa ṭaḥ mā i k gahaṇam kim daṇḍinaḥ aṭṭhi  ve vosu lussa
translated: In the neuter, the -a of jhasa becomes -o, and the -u of issa becomes -u, when the word is preceded by a word ending in a vowel: aggaso, aggī; jhaggahaṇaṃ kiṃ? aggaṃ. The -i of ikā becomes -o, when the word is preceded by a word ending in a vowel: rattiyo; iggahaṇaṃ kiṃ? daṇḍino. The -u of puveti becomes -o, when the word is preceded by a word ending in a vowel: aṭṭhi.

original: Lasaññassa ussa dvevosu ṭa hoti; bhikkhave, bhikkhavo, vevosūti-kiṃ?Cantuyo; uggahaṇaṃ kiṃ; sayambhuvo.🔽Yomhi vā kvavi-.
analyzed: la saññassa ussa d ve vosu ṭa hoti bhikkhave bhikkhavaḥ uggahaṇam kim sayambhuvaḥ  yomhi vā kvavi
translated: In the neuter, the -u of lussa becomes -o, when the word is preceded by a word ending in a vowel: bhikkhave, bhikkhavo, vevosūti-kiṃ? cantuyo. The -u of uggahaṇa becomes -o, when the word is preceded by a word ending in a vowel: sayambhuvo.

original: Yomhī kvaci lasaññassa vā ṭa hoti; hetayo,’nandanti taṃ kurayo dassanena ajjeva taṃ kurayo pāpayātu’ vāti-kiṃ hetuyo.🔽Pumālapane vevo-.
analyzed: kvaci kvaci hoti hetayaḥ nandanti tam kurayaḥ dassanena ajjā iva tam kurayaḥ pāpa yātu  pumān ālapane vevaḥ
translated: In the neuter, the -u of yomhi becomes -o, or the -u of kvaci becomes -o, when the word is preceded by a word ending in a vowel: hetayo, nandanti taṃ kurayo dassanena ajjeva taṃ kurayo pāpayātu; vāti-kiṃ hetuyo.

original: Lasaññato uto yossālapane vevo honti vā pulliṅge; bhikkhave, bhikkhavo, bhikkhū–-pumeti-kiṃ; āyūni; ālapaneti-kiṃ?Cantuyo tiṭṭhanti; lutātvevै-dhenuyo,sayambhuvo.
analyzed: la sañña taḥ u taḥ yossa ālapane vā ivaḥ honti vā pul liṅge bhikkhave bhikkhavaḥ āyūni tiṭṭhanti tiṭṭhanti
translated: In the neuter, the -u of uto becomes -o, or the -u of yossālapane becomes -o, when the word is preceded by a word ending in a vowel: bhikkhave, bhikkhavo, bhikkhū; pumāti-kiṃ? āyūni; ālapaneti-kiṃ? cantuyo tiṭṭhanti; lutātvevै-dhenuyo, sayambhuvo.

original: Smāhisminnaṃ mhābhimhi-.
analyzed: sma ahi sminnam mha abhimhi
translated: In the neuter, the -u of smāhisminnaṃ becomes -o, or the -u of mhābhimhi becomes -o, when the word is preceded by a word ending in a vowel:

original: Nāmasmā paresaṃ smāhisminnaṃ mhābhimhi vā honti yathā kkamaṃ; buddhamhā, buddhasmā, buddhehi, buddhamhi, buddhasmiṃ–-bahulādhikārāpavādavīsaye’pi; dasasahassimhi dhātuyā.🔽Suhisvasse-.
analyzed: paresam vā honti yathā kkamam buddhamhā buddhasmā buddhehi buddhamhi buddhasmin bahula adhikāra apavāda vīsaye pi dasa sahassimhi dhātuyā  su hi svasse
translated: The forms of the words Buddha, etc., are formed in the same way, according to the rules given above, as follows: buddhamhā, buddhasmā, buddhehi, buddhamhi, buddhasmiṃ.

original: Akārantassa suhisve hoti; buddhesu, buddhehi.
analyzed: a kāra antassa su hi sve hoti buddhesu buddhehi
translated: The forms in suhisve are: buddhesu, buddhehi.

original: Sabbādīnaṃ namhi ca-.🔽Akārantānaṃ sabbādīnaṃ e hoti namhi suhisuca; sabbesaṃ sabbesu, sabbehi–-sabbādīnanti-kiṃ?Buddhānaṃ; assetveva amūsaṃ.
analyzed: sabba ādīnam namhi ca  akāra antānam sabba ādīnam e hoti namhi su hi su ca sabbesam sabbesu sabbehi sabba ādīnam ti kiṃbuddhānam assa itu eva amūsam
translated: The forms in namhi and suhisuca are: sabbesaṃ, sabbesu, sabbehi.🔽The forms in amūsaṃ are: buddhānaṃ.🔽Sabba, katara, katama, ubhaya, itara, añña, aññatara, aññatama,

original: Sabba katara katama ubhaya itara añña aññatara aññatama;🔽Pubbaparāparadakkhiṇuttarādharāni vavatthāyamasaññāyaṃ-().
analyzed: sabba katara katama ubhaya itara añña aññatara aññatama  pubba para apara dakkhiṇa uttara adharāni
translated: pubba, para, aparā, dakkhiṇa, uttara, adhara,

original: Yatya ta eta ima amu kiṃ eka tumha amha (iccete sabbādayo )🔽Saṃsānaṃ-.
analyzed: ya tya te ete ima amu kim eka tumha amha icca ete sabba ādayaḥ  saṃsānam
translated: yattha, ta, eta, ima, amu, kiṃ, eka, tumha, amha.

original: Sabbādito naṃvacanassa saṃsānaṃ honti; sabbesaṃ, sabbesānaṃ.🔽Ghapā sassa ssā vā-.
analyzed: sabba āditaḥ naṃ vacanassa saṃsānam honti sabbesam sabbesānam 🔽gha pā sassa ssā vā
translated: The forms in saṃsānaṃ are: sabbesaṃ, sabbesānaṃ.🔽The forms in ssā and ssā vā are: sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sabbesaṃ, sab

original: Sabbādīnaṃ ghapato sassa ssā vā hoti; sabbassā, sabbāya, paggahaṇamuttaratthaṃ.🔽Smino ssaṃ-.
analyzed: sabba ādīnam gha pataḥ sa ssa ssā vā hoti sabba ssā sabbāya paggahaṇam uttara ttham  sminaḥ ssam
translated: The forms sabbassa, sabbāya, etc., are formed by adding the feminine ending -ā to the masculine forms sabbassa, sabbassaṃ, etc.

original: Sabbādīnaṃ ghapato smino ssaṃ vā hoti; sabbassaṃ, sabbāya; amussaṃ, amuyā.🔽Yaṃ-.
analyzed: sabba ādīnam gha pataḥ sminaḥ ssam vā hoti sabbassam sabbāya amussam amuyā  yam
translated: The forms sabbassa, sabbāya, etc., are formed by adding the feminine ending -ā to the masculine forms sabbassa, sabbassaṃ, etc.

original: Ghapato smino yaṃ vā hoti; kaññāyaṃ, daññāya, rattiyaṃ, rattiyā, vadhuyaṃ, vadhuyā, sabbāyaṃ, sabbāya, amuyaṃ, amuyā.🔽Tiṃ sabhāparisāya-.
analyzed: ghapato sminaḥ yam vā hoti kaññāyam daññāya rattiyam rattiyā vadhuyam vadhuyā sabbāyam sabbāya amuyam amuyā  tim sabhā parisāya
translated: The forms kaññāyaṃ, daññāya, rattiyaṃ, rattiyā, vadhuyaṃ, vadhuyā, sabbāyaṃ, sabbāya, amuyaṃ, amuyā, are formed by adding the feminine ending -ā to the masculine forms kaññāya, daññāya, rattiyā, vadhuya, sabbāya, amuyā.

original: Sabhāparisāhi smino tiṃ vā hoti; sabhatiṃ, sahāya, parisatiṃ, parisāya.🔽Padādīhi si-.
analyzed: sabhā parisāhi tim vā hoti sabhatim sahāya parisatim parisāya  pada ādi hi si
translated: The forms sabhatiṃ, sahāya, parisatiṃ, parisāya, are formed by adding the feminine ending -ī to the masculine forms sabhāparisā.

original: Ehi smino si hoti vā, padasi, padasmiṃ, bilasi, bilasmiṃ.🔽Nāssa sā-.
analyzed: ehi vā padasi padasmin bilasmin  na assa sā
translated: The forms padasi, padasmiṃ, bilasi, bilasmiṃ, are formed by adding the feminine ending -ī to the masculine forms padam, bilā.

original: Padādīhi nāssa sā hoti vā; padasā, padena, bilasā, bilena.🔽Kodhādīhi-.
analyzed: pada ādīhi sā hoti vā padasā padena bilasā bilena  kodha ādīhi
translated: The forms padasā, padena, bilasā, bilena, are formed by adding the feminine ending -ā to the masculine forms padam, bilā.

original: Ehi nāssa sā hoti vā; kodhasā, kodhena, atthasā, atthena.🔽Atena-.🔽Akārantato parassa nāvavanassa enādeso hoti; buddhena; atoti-kiṃ?Agginā.
analyzed: ehi na assa sā hoti vā kodhasā kodhena atthasā atthena  a tena  akāra antataḥ parassa nāva vanassa ena ādesaḥ hoti buddhena a totikiṃagginā
translated: The forms kodhasā, kodhena, atthasā, atthena, are formed by adding the feminine ending -ā to the masculine forms kodho, attho.

original: Sisso-.
analyzed: sisso
translated: The forms buddhena, etc., are formed by adding the feminine ending -enā to the masculine forms buddha, etc.🔽The forms buddhisā, buddhena, etc., are formed by adding the feminine ending -ā to the masculine forms buddhi, etc.

original: Akārantato nāmasmā sissa o hoti; buddho; ato tveva-aggi.
analyzed: akāra antataḥ nāmasmā sissa o hoti buddhaḥ atas tu eva aggi
translated: After a noun ending in a vowel, o is substituted for ssa; Buddha, from this very (word) fire.

original: Kvace vā-.
analyzed: kva ce vā
translated: In some places vā.

original: Akārantato nāmasmā sissa e hoti vā kvaci;’vanappa gumbe yathā phussitagge’ apavādavisaye’pi
analyzed: akāra antataḥ nāmasmā si ssaḥ e hoti vā gumbe yathā apavāda visaye pi
translated: After a noun ending in a vowel, e is substituted for ssa or vā in some places; ‘As in a forest grove, in a flowering tree’ (is an example of e); in the exception ‘apavāda’ (is an example of vā).

original: bahulaṃ vidhānā, sukhe, dukkhe–-vāti-kiṃ? Vanappagumbo; kvacīti-kiṃ? Pakkhe sabbattha mā hotu.
analyzed: bahulam vidhānā sukhe kvaci itikim pakkhe sabbattha mā hotu
translated: In the majority of cases, in sukha, dukkha–vāti-kiṃ? Forest grove; kvacīti-kiṃ? Wing, everywhere let it not be.

original: Aṃ napuṃsake-.
analyzed: am napuṃsake
translated: Aṃ in the neuter.

original: Akārantato nāmasmā sassa aṃ hoti napuṃsakaliṅge rūpaṃ.
analyzed: akāra antataḥ nāmasmā sassa aṃ hoti napuṃsaka liṅge rūpam
translated: After a noun ending in a vowel, aṃ is substituted for ssa in the neuter gender; form.

original: Yonaṃ ni-.
analyzed: yonam ni
translated: In the Yona language ni.

original: Akārantato nāmasmā yonaṃ ni hoti napuṃsake; sabbāni, rūpāni –-niccavidhāne phalamekaccādisabbādanaṃ paṭhamāya.
analyzed: akāra antataḥ nāmasmai yonam ni hoti napuṃsake sabbāni rūpāni nicca vidhāne phalam ekacca ādi sabba adanam paṭhamāya
translated: After a noun ending in a vowel, ni is substituted for ssa in the neuter; all, forms – in the fixed rule ni, one of the many in the first (case).

original: Jhalā vā-.
analyzed: jha lā vā
translated: Jhalā or vā.

original: Jhalato yonaṃ ni hoti vā napuṃsake; aṭṭhini, aṭṭhī, āyūni, āyū.
analyzed: jha lataḥ yonam ni hoti vā napuṃsake aṭṭhini aṭṭhī āyūni āyū
translated: After jhal, ni is substituted for ssa or vā in the neuter; bones, bone, years, years.

original: Lopo-.
analyzed: lopaḥ
translated: Lopa.

original: Jhalato yonaṃ lopo hoti; aṭṭhī, āyū, aggī, bhikkhū, jhalātveva-aggayo; pageva kasmā na hoti; antaraṅgattā ākarassa.
analyzed: jha lataḥ yonam lopaḥ hoti aṭṭhī āyū aggī bhikkhū pagā iva kasmā na hoti antaraṅgattā ākarassa
translated: After jhal, lopa is substituted for ssa; bone, year, fire, monks, after jhal only in agga; why is it not so in other (words)? Because of the inner position of the āka.

original: Jantutvīghepehi vā-.
analyzed: jantu tvī ghepa ehi vā
translated: Jantutvīghepehi or vā.

original: Jantuhetūhi īkārantehi ghapasaññohiva paresaṃ yonaṃ vā lopo hoti; jantu jantuyo,
analyzed: jantu hetūhi īkāra antehi paresam vā lopaḥ hoti jantu
translated: The vowel of the penultimate syllable is lengthened, and the vowel of the final syllable is elided, in the words of the following classes, as if they were the names of other people’s clans: jantu jantuyo,

original: hetu hetuyo, daddhī daddhīyo, kaññā kaññāyo, rattī rattiyo, itthī itthiyo, deṇū deṇuyā, vैdhū vadhuyo.
analyzed: hetu hetuyaḥ daddhī daddhīyaḥ kaññā kaññāyaḥ rattī rattiyaḥ itthī itthiyaḥ deṇū deṇuyā vdhū vadhuyaḥ
translated: hetu hetuyo, daddhī daddhīyo, kaññā kaññāyo, rattī rattiyo, itthī itthiyo, deṇū deṇuyā, vैdhū vadhuyo.

original: Yepassivaṇṇassa-.🔽Pasaññassa ivaṇṇassa lopo hoti vā yakāre; ratyo ratyā ratyaṃ, pokkharañño pokkharañññā
analyzed: yepassi vaṇṇassa  pa saññassa i va ṇṇassa lopaḥ hoti vā yakāre ratyoḥ ratyāḥ ratyam pokkharañño pokkharaññā
translated: As if in the word of the following class:🔽The vowel of the final syllable is elided, as if it were the vowel of the penultimate syllable, in the words of the following class: ratyo ratyā ratyaṃ, pokkharañño pokkharaññā pokkharaññaṃ.

original: pokkharaññaṃ–-vātveva-rattiyo; passāti-kiṃ?Daddhiyo; ivaṇṇassāti-kiṃ? Dhenuyo vadhuyā;
analyzed: pokkharaññam vā tveva rattiyaḥ dhenuyaḥ vadhuyā
translated: As if in the words rattiyo, passāti. What? In the words daddhīyo. What? In the words deṇuyā vadhuyā.

original: kैthaṃ; anuññāto ahaṃ matyāti?’ Ye passā’ti-yogavibhāgā.
analyzed: ktham anuññātaḥ aham matyā ati ye passa atiyoga vibhāgā
translated: How? “I am permitted by my mother.” Ye passā. By the analysis of the compound.

original: Gasīnaṃ-.
analyzed: gasīnam
translated: As if in the words of the following class:

original: Nāmasmā gasīnaṃ lopo hoti vijjhantarābhāve; bho purisa, ayaṃ daddhī.
analyzed: lopaḥ hoti vijjhantara abhāve bho purisa ayam daddhī
translated: The vowel of the final syllable is elided in the words of the following class, when the meaning of the compound is not understood: bho purisa, ayaṃ daddhī.

original: Asaṃkhyehi sabbāsaṃ-.
analyzed: asaṃkhyehi
translated: In all words of the following class:

original: Avijjamānasaṅkhyehi parāsaṃ sabbāsaṃ vibhattīnaṃ lopohoti;va vā evaevaṃ. Etasmāyeva liṅgā [ ] asaṅkhyehi syāthuppattyanumīyate.
analyzed: a vijjamāna saṅkhyehi parāsam sabbāsam vibhattīnam vā eva evam liṅgāḥ a saṅkhyehi
translated: The vowel of the final syllable is elided in all words of the following class, when the number is not understood: va vā evaṃ. From this very indication, it is inferred that it is so in the words of the following class, when the number is not understood.

original: Ekatthatāyaṃ-.
analyzed: ekatthatā ayam
translated: In the words of the following class:

original: Ekatthībhāve sabbāsaṃ vibhattīnaṃ lopo hoti bahulaṃ; puttīyati, rājapuriso, vāsiṭṭho–-
analyzed: ekatthībhāve sabbāsam vibhattīnam lopaḥ hoti bahulam puttīyati rāja purisaḥ vāsiṭṭhaḥ
translated: In the case of the same meaning, there is, for all the cases, generally elision of the case-endings; puttiyati, rājapuriso, vāsiṭṭho.

original: kvavi na hoti bahulaṃ vidhānā; parantapo. Bhagandaro, parassapadaṃ, attanopadaṃ,
analyzed: kvavi na hoti bahulam vidhānā parantapaḥ bhagandaraḥ parassapadam attanopadam
translated: Kvavi is not generally so; parantapo. Bhagandaro, parassapadaṃ, attanopadaṃ,

original: gavampati, devānampiyatisso, antevāsī, janesuto, mamattaṃ, māmako.
analyzed: gavampati devānampiya tissaḥ antevāsī janesutaḥ mamattam māmakaḥ
translated: gavampati, devānampiyatisso, antevāsī, janesuto, mamattaṃ, māmako.

original: Pubbasmāmādito-.
analyzed: pup basma āma āditaḥ
translated: Before the first case ending,

original: Amādekatthā pubbaṃ yadekatthaṃ tato parāsaṃ sabbāsaṃ vibhattīnaṃ lopo hoti; adhitthī–-idha na hoti bahulaṃ vidhānā, yathāpattiyā, yayathāparisāya; pubbasmāti-kiṃ?Gāmaṃ gato.
analyzed: amāt ekatthā pubbam yat ekattham tatas parāsam sabbāsam vibhattīnam lopaḥ hoti na hoti bahulam vidhānā yathā āpattiyā ya yathā parisāya pubbasmā atikiṃgāmam gataḥ
translated: when the first case ending is the same meaning, there is, for all the case-endings after it, generally elision; adhitthī. Here kvavi is not generally so; yathāpattiyā, yayathāparisāya. Before the first case ending: what? Gāmaṃ gato.

original: Nātomapañcamiyā-.
analyzed: na a toma pañcamiyā
translated: Not in the fifth case, when the first case ending is the same meaning,

original: Amādekatthā pubbaṃ yadekatthamakārantaṃ tato parāsaṃ sabbāsaṃ vibhattīnaṃ lopo na hoti astu bhavatyapañcamyā; upakumbhaṃ, apañcamiyāti-kiṃ? Upakumbhā ānaya.
analyzed: amāt ekatthā pubbam yat ekattham akāra antam tatas parāsam sabbāsam vibhattīnam lopaḥ na hoti astu bhavati a pañcamyā upakumbham upakumbhaḥ ānaya
translated: when the first case ending is not a verbal root, there is, for all the case-endings after it, not elision, except in the fifth case; upakumbhaṃ. Except in the fifth case: what? Upakumbhā ānaya.

original: Vā taniyāsattaminaṃ-
analyzed: vā taniyā sattaminam
translated: In the seventh case, and in the locative case,

original: Amādekatthā pubbaṃ yadekatthamakārantaṃ tato parāsaṃ tatiyāsattaminaṃ vā aṃ hoti; upakumbhena kataṃ, upakumbhaṃ kataṃ, upakumbhe nidhehi, upakumbhaṃ nidhehi.
analyzed: amāt ekatthā pubbam yat ekattham akāra antam tatas parāsam tatiyā sattaminam vā aṃ hoti upa kumbhena katam upa kumbham katam upa kumbhe nidhehi upa kumbham nidhehi
translated: The first of the two words having the same meaning, if the second has no case-ending, then the third or seventh has aṃ; upakumbhena kataṃ, upakumbhaṃ kataṃ, upakumbhe nidhehi, upakumbhaṃ nidhehi.

original: Rājassi nāmhi-.
analyzed: rājassi nāmhi
translated: Rājassi nāmhi.

original: Nāmhi rājassi vā hoti; sabbadattena rājinā; vātve varaññā.
analyzed: nāmhi rājassi vā hoti sabba dattena rājinā vā atve varaññā
translated: Rājassa is or si is added; sabbadattena rājinā; vātve varaññā.

original: Sunaṃhisū-.
analyzed: su naṃ hi sū
translated: Sunaṃhisū.

original: Rājassa ū hoti vā sunaṃhisu; rājūsu rājesu, rājūnaṃ raññaṃ, rājūbhi rājebhi.
analyzed: rājassa u hoti vā rājūsu rājesu rājūnam raññam rājūbhi rājebhi
translated: Rājassa ū is added or is not added; sunaṃhisu; rājūsu rājesu, rājūnaṃ raññaṃ, rājūbhi rājebhi.

original: Imassānitthiyaṃ ṭe-.
analyzed: imassa an itthiyam ṭe
translated: Imassānitthiyaṃ ṭe.

original: Imasaddassānitthiyaṃ ṭe hoti vā sunaṃhisu; esu imesu, esaṃ imesaṃ, ehi imehi–-anitthiyanti-kiṃ? Imāsu, imāyaṃ, imāhi.
analyzed: ima saddassa anitthiyam ṭe hoti vā esu imesu esam imesam ehi imehi anitthiyantikim imāsu imāyam imāhi
translated: Imassa is added or is not added; nitthiyaṃ sunaṃhisu; esu imesu, esaṃ imesaṃ, ehi imehi; nitthiyaṃ—what? imāsu, imāyaṃ, imāhi.

original: Nāmbhanimi-.
analyzed: na ambha nimi
translated: Nāmbhanimi.

original: Imasaddassānitthiyaṃ nāmhi anैmi iccādesā honti; anena, iminā; anitthiyaṃtveva-imāya.
analyzed: ima saddassa an itthiyam nāmhi anmi icca ādesāḥ honti anena iminā an itthiyam tu eva emāya
translated: Imassa is added or is not added; nitthiyaṃ sunaṃhisu; anena, iminā; nitthiyaṃ—what? imāya.

original: Sīmbhanapuṃsakassāyaṃ-.
analyzed: sīmbha napuṃsakaḥ sāyam
translated: Sīmbhanapuṃsakassāyaṃ.

original: Imasaddassānapuṃsakassa ayaṃ hoti simhi; ayaṃ puriso, ayaṃ itthī; anapuṃsakassāti-kiṃ?Imaṃ.🔽Tyatetānaṃ tassa so-
analyzed: ima saddassa a napuṃsakassa ayam hoti simhi ayam purisaḥ ayam itthī a napuṃsakassa ati kiṃimam 🔽tassa saḥ
translated: Imassa is added or is not added; anapuṃsakassa sunaṃhisu; ayaṃ puriso, ayaṃ itthī; anapuṃsakassāti—what? imaṃ.

original: Tyatetānamanapuṃsakānaṃ tassa so hoti simhi; syo puriso, syā itthi; evaṃ so, sā, eso, esā –-anapuṃsaka ssetvैva-tyaṃ, taṃ, etaṃ.🔽Massāmussa-.
analyzed: tya t etānam a napuṃsakānam tassa saḥ hoti simhi puriso syā itthi evam saḥ sā esaḥ esā anapuṃsaka tam etam  massa amussa
translated: In the case of those neuter words which are not masculine or feminine, the form in the accusative singular is the same as that in the accusative plural.🔽In the case of those neuter words which are not masculine or feminine, the form in the locative singular is the same as that in the locative plural.

original: Anapuṃsakassāmussa makārassa so hoti simhi; asu puriso, asu itthi.🔽Ke vā-.
analyzed: a napuṃsakassa amussa makārassa saḥ hoti simhi asu purisaḥ asu itthi  ke vā
translated: In the case of those neuter words which are not masculine or feminine, the form in the ablative singular is the same as that in the ablative plural.🔽In the case of those neuter words which are not masculine or feminine, the form in the genitive singular is the same as that in the genitive plural.

original: Amussa massa ke vā so hoti; asuko amuko, asukā amukā, asukaṃ amukaṃ, asukāni amukāni.🔽Tatassa no sabbāsu-.🔽Tasaddassa tassa no vā hoti sabbāsuvibhattīsu; ne, te, nāyo, tāyo, naṃ, taṃ, nāni, tāni iccādi.
analyzed: amussa massa ke vā saḥ hoti asukaḥ amukaḥ asukāḥ amukāḥ asukam amukam asukāni amukāni  tatassa no sabbāsu  ta saddassa tassa no vā hoti sabbāsu vibhattīsu ne te nāyo tāyo naṃ tam nāni tāni iccādi
translated: In the case of those neuter words which are not masculine or feminine, the form in the instrumental singular is the same as that in the instrumental plural.🔽In the case of those neuter words which are not masculine or feminine, the form in the dative singular is the same as that in the dative plural.

original: Ṭa sasmāsmiṃssāyayassaṃssāsaṃmbhāmhisavimassa ca-.🔽Sādisvimassa tatassa ca ṭo vā hoti; assैmassa, asmā, imasmā, asmiṃ imasmiṃ,assāya
analyzed: ṭa sa sma asmiṃssa aya yassa assa āsambha āmhisa vimassa ca  sa ādi su imassa tatassa ca ṭaḥ vā hoti assmassa asmai imasmai asmin
translated: In the case of those neuter words which are not masculine or feminine, the form in the ablative singular is the same as that in the ablative plural.🔽In the case of those neuter words which are not masculine or feminine, the form in the genitive singular is the same as that in the genitive plural.

original: imissāya, assaṃ imassaṃ, assā imissā, āsaṃ imāsaṃ, amhā imamhā, amhi imamhi; assa
analyzed: imissāya assam imassam assā imissā āsam imāsam amhā imamhā amhi imamhi assa
translated: In the case of those neuter words which are not masculine or feminine, the form in the locative singular is the same as that in the locative plural.

original: tassa, asmā tasmā, asmiṃ tasmiṃ, assāya tassāya, assaṃ tassaṃ, assā tassā, āsaṃ tāsaṃ,
analyzed: tassa tasmai asmin tasmin assāya tassāya assam tassam assā tassā āsam tāsam
translated: from that, in that, in those.

original: amhā tamhā, amhi tamhi. Ssāyādiggahaṇa mādesantare mā hotutī.
analyzed: amhi tamhi amhi tamhi
translated: The words ‘ssā, etc.’ are mentioned in order to prevent the omission of the m-vowel.

original: Ṭā sissisismā-.
analyzed: ṭā sis sis smā
translated: Ṭā sissisismā-.

original: Isismā sissa ṭe vā hoti;’ yonajja vinaye kaṅkhaṃ atthadhammavidū ise’ vātveva-isi.
analyzed: isismā sissa ṭe vā hoti vinaye kaṅkham attha dhamma vidū ise
translated: Isismā sissa ṭe vā hoti; ‘Yonajja vinaye kaṅkhaṃ atthadhammavidū ise’ vātveva-isi.

original: Dutiyassa yossa-.
analyzed: dutiyassa yossa
translated: Dutiyassa yossa-.

original: Isismā parassa duyāyossa ṭe vā hoti;’ samaṇe brāhmaṇe vande sampannacaraṇe ise’ vātveva-isayo passa; dutiyassāti-kiṃ?Isayo tiṭṭhanti.
analyzed: isismā parassa ṭe vā hoti samaṇe brāhmaṇe vande sampanna caraṇe ise passa dutiyassa ati kiṃisayo tiṭṭhanti
translated: Isismā parassa duyāyossa ṭe vā hoti; ‘Samaṇe brāhmaṇe vande sampannacaraṇe ise’ vātveva-isayo passa; dutiyassāti-kiṃ? Isayo tiṭṭhanti.

original: Ekaccādigato-.
analyzed: eka c ca ādi gataḥ
translated: Ekaccādigato-.

original: Akārantehi ekaccādīhi yonaṃ ṭe hoti; ekacce tiṭṭhanti, ekacce passa–-atoti-kiṃ? Ekaccāyo; evaṃ esasa paṭhama.
analyzed: akāra antehi ekacca ādīhi yonam ṭe hoti ekacce tiṭṭhanti ekacce evam evam
translated: Akārantehi ekaccādīhi yonaṃ ṭe hoti; ekacce tiṭṭhanti, ekacce passa–-atoti-kiṃ? Ekaccāyo; evaṃ esasa paṭhama.

original: Na nissa ṭā-.
analyzed: na nis ṭā
translated: Na nissa ṭā-.

original: Ekaccādīhi parassa nissa ṭā na hoti; ekaccāni.
analyzed: ekacca ādīhi parassa nissa ṭā na hoti ekaccāni
translated: Ekaccādīhi parassa nissa ṭā na hoti; ekaccāni.

original: Sabbādīhi parassa nissa ṭā na hoti; sabbāni.
analyzed: sabba ādīhi parassa nissa ṭā na hoti sabbāni
translated: Sabbādīhi parassa nissa ṭā na hoti; sabbāni.

original: Yeyānameṭa-.
analyzed: yeyānameṭa
translated: Yeyānameṭa-.

original: Akārantehi sabbādīhi yonameṭa hoti; sabbe tiṭṭhanti sabbe passa; atotveva-sabbāyo.
analyzed: akāra antehi sabba ādīhi hoti sabbe tiṭṭhanti sabbe passa a to tu eva sabba ayo
translated: With akāraṇta sabba, etc., the feminine is eṭa: sabbe tiṭṭhanti = sabbeṭā, sabbe passati = sabbeṭā, atotveva = sabbeṭāyo.

original: Nāññañca nāmappadhānā-.
analyzed: na aññañca nāma ppadhānā
translated: And with nāññaṃ nāmappadhānā.

original: Nāmabhutehi appadhānehi ca sabbādīhi yaṃ vuttaṃ yaṃ caññaṃ sabbādikāriyantaṃ na hoti; te sabbā, te piyasabbā, te ati sabbā.
analyzed: nāma bhutehi appadhānehi ca sabba ādīhi yam vuttam yam caññam sabba ādi kāriyantam na hoti te sabbā te piya sabbā te ati sabbā
translated: With nāmabhūta and appadhāna, sabba, etc., is said, and with what is not made sabba, etc., they are: sabbā, te piyasabbā, te ati sabbā.

original: Tatiyatthayoge-.
analyzed: tatiya ttha yoge
translated: With tatiyatthayoge.

original: Tatiyatthena yoge sabbādīhi yaṃ vuttaṃ yaṃ caññaṃ sabbādi kāriyantaṃ na hoti; māsenapubbānaṃ māsapubbānaṃ.
analyzed: tatiya tthena yoge sabba ādīhi yam vuttam yam caññam sabba ādi kāriyantam na hoti māsenapubbānam māsa pubbānam
translated: With tatiya, the meaning, sabba, etc., is said, and with what is not made sabba, etc., they are: māsenapubbānaṃ, māsapubbānaṃ.

original: Catthasamāse-.
analyzed: cattha samāse
translated: With catutthasamāse.

original: Catthasamāsavisaye sabbādīhi yaṃ vuttaṃ yaṃ caññaṃ sabbādi kāriyantaṃ na hoti; dakkhiṇuttarapubbānaṃ–-samāseti-kiṃ?Amusañca tesañca dehi.
analyzed: cattha samāsa visaye sabba ādīhi yam vuttam yam caññam sabba ādi kāriyantam na hoti tesam ca dehi
translated: In the sphere of the fourth compound, sabba, etc., is said, and with what is not made sabba, etc., they are: dakkhiṇuttarapubbānaṃ. In a compound? Give to them and to those.

original: Veṭa-.
analyzed: veṭa
translated: Veṭa.

original: Catthasamāsavisaye sabbādīhi yasseṭa vutto tassa vā hoti; pubbuttare, pubbuttarā.
analyzed: cattha samāsa visaye sabba ādīhi yassa iṭa vuttaḥ tassa vā hoti pubba uttare pubba uttarā
translated: In the sphere of the fourth compound, the feminine is eṭa, of what is said with sabba, etc., they are: pubbuttare, pubbuttarā.

original: Pubbādīhi jahi-
analyzed: pubba ādīhi jahi
translated: With pubba, etc., jahi.

original: Etehi pubbādīhi chahi savisaye eṭa vā hoti?Pubbe pubbā, pare parā, apare aparā,dakkhiṇe dakkhiṇā, uttare uttarā, adhare adharā–-chahīti-kiṃ?Ye.[ ]
analyzed: etehi pubba ādīhi chahi sa visaye vā hoti pubbe pubbā pare parā apare aparā dakkhiṇe dakkhiṇā uttare uttarā adhare adharā chahi iti kiṃye
translated: The six: what? Those.

original: Manādīhi smiṃsaṃnāsmānaṃ sisoosāsā-.
analyzed: sisoosāsā
translated: With man, etc., smiṃ, sam, nā, asmānaṃ, siso, osāsā.

original: Manādīhi samīmādīnaṃ sisoosāsā vā honti yathākkaṃ; manasi manasmiṃ, manaso manassa,
analyzed: mana ādīhi sisoosāsāḥ vā honti yathākkam manasi manasmin manasaḥ manassa
translated: With man, etc., smiṃ, sam, nā, asmānaṃ, siso, osāsā are used according to the case; in the mind, in the thought, of the thought, of the mind,🔽the mind, the thought, with the mind, with the thought, with the mind, from the mind.

original: mano manaṃ, manasā manena, manasā manasmā–-kathaṃ? Putto jāto avetaso, hitvā yāti
analyzed: manaḥ manam manasā manena manasā akatham puttaḥ jātaḥ a vetasaḥ hitvā yāti
translated: How? The son born, the one not bound, having left, he goes,

original: sumedhaso; suddhuttaravāsasā, hemakapakpaṇavāsaseti-sakatthe ṇantā.🔽Mana tama tapa teja sira ura vaca oja raja yasa paya
analyzed: sumedhasaḥ suddhuttara vāsasā hemaka pakpaṇa vāsasā iti saka tthe ṇantā  mana tama tapa teja sira ura vaca oja raja yasa paya
translated: the one of good understanding; with a pure upper garment, with a golden necklace.

original: Saravayayāyavāsacetā jalāsayākkhayalohapaṭamanesu-().
analyzed: sara vaya yāya vāsa cetāḥ jala asaya a kkhaya loha paṭa manesu
translated: The case-endings ṇan, etc., are used in the sense of “that.”

original: Sato sabbhe-.
analyzed: sataḥ sap bhe
translated: Sato, sabbhe.

original: Santasaddassa saba bhavati bhakāre; sabbhi.
analyzed: santa saddassa saba bhavati bhakāre sap bhi
translated: The word santa becomes saba in the vowel a; with all.

original: Bhavato vā honto gayonāse-.
analyzed: bhavataḥ vā hontaḥ gayonāse
translated: Or bhavato becomes honto in gayonāse.

original: Bhavantasaddassa bhontādeso vā hoti gayonāse; bhonta, bhavaṃ, bhonto, bhavanto, bhotā,
analyzed: bhavanta saddassa bhonta ādesaḥ vā hoti bhonta bhavam bhontaḥ bhavantaḥ bhotā
translated: The word bhavantas becomes bhontādeso in gayonāse; bhonta, bhavaṃ, bhonto, bhavanto, bhotā,

original: bhavatā, bhoto, bhavato–-bho iti-āmantaṇe nipāto’kutonu āgacchatha bho tayo janā’evaṃ
analyzed: bhavatā bhotaḥ bhavataḥ bho iti āmantaṇe nipātaḥ u kutas nu āgacchatha bho tayaḥ janāḥ evam
translated: Bhavatā, bhoto, bhavato–bho is a particle used in addressing. It comes from the word bho, which means ‘sir’. The three persons are addressed thus: ‘Come, sirs, the three of you.’

original: bhanteti-bhaddeti-saddantarena siddhaṃ;bhaddanta iti-dassa dvibhāvena.
analyzed: bhanta iti bhadda iti sadda antarena siddham bhaddantaḥ iti dassa dvi bhāvena
translated: Bhante is formed with the word bhadde, ‘blessed one’. Bhaddanta is formed with the word bhadde and the dual ending -ta.

original: Sissāggito ni-.
analyzed: si ssā a g itaḥ ni
translated: Ni is added to the end of a pupil’s name.

original: Aggismā sissa ni hoti vā; agginī,aggi.
analyzed: aggismā sissa ni hoti vai agginīaggi
translated: Ni is added to the end of a pupil’s name, or not: aggini,aggi.

original: Ntassaṃ-.
analyzed: ntas sam
translated: Aṃ is added to nta.

original: Simhi ntappaccayassa aṃ hoti vā; gacchaṃ, gacchanto.🔽Bhuto-.
analyzed: simhi n ta paccayassa aṃ hoti vā gaccham gacchantaḥ  bhu taḥ
translated: Aṃ is added to nta after simhi, or not: gacchaṃ, gacchanto.

original: Bhudhātuto ntassa aṃ hoti simhi niccaṃ punabbidhānā; bhavaṃ.
analyzed: bhu dhātutaḥ ntassa am hoti simhi niccam punabbidhānā bhavam
translated: Aṃ is added to nta after bhūta and bhūta-ta, always, by re-arrangement: bhavaṃ.

original: Mahantarahattānaṃ ṭā vā-.🔽Simhi mahantārahantānaṃ ntassa ṭā vā hoti; mahā, mahaṃ, arahā, arahaṃ.
analyzed: mahanta rahat tānam ṭā vā  simhi mahanta arahantānam ntassa ṭā vā hoti mahā maham arahāḥ araham
translated: Ṭā is added to mahant, arahan, or not.🔽Ṭā is added to nta after simhi, to mahant and arahan, or not: mahā, mahaṃ, arahā, arahaṃ.

original: Ntussa-.
analyzed: ntussa
translated: Ṭā is added to ntu after simhi.

original: Simhi ntussaṭā hoti; guṇavā.
analyzed: simhi n tus saṭā hoti guṇavā
translated: Ṭā is added to ntu after simhi: guṇavā.

original: Aṃṅaṃ napuṃsake-.
analyzed: aṃ ṅam napuṃsake
translated: Aṃṅaṃ is added to napumsaka.

original: Ntussa aṃṅaṃ honti simhi napuṃsake; guṇavaṃ kulaṃ, guṇañca ntaṃ kulaṃ–-napuṃsaketi kiṃ? Sīlavā bhikkhu.
analyzed: n tussa aṃ ṅam honti simhi napuṃsake guṇavam kulam guṇam ca ntam kulam napuṃsaka iti kim sīlavā bhikkhu
translated: Aṃṅaṃ is added to ntu after simhi, in the neuter: guṇavaṃ kulaṃ, guṇañca ntaṃ kulaṃ. In the masculine: sīlavā bhikkhu.

original: Himavato vā o-.
analyzed: himavataḥ vā o
translated: O is added to Himavanta, or not.

original: Himavato simhi ntussa o vā hoti; himavanto, himavā.🔽Rājādiyuvāditvā -.
analyzed: himavataḥ simhi ntussa o vā hoti himavantaḥ himavā 🔽rāja ādi yuva ādi tvā
translated: O is added to nta after simhi, to Himavanta, or not: Himavanto, Himavā.

original: Rājādīhi yayuvādīhi ca sissa ā hoti; rājā, yayuvā–-rāja brahma sakha atta ātuma.🔽Dhammo vāññatthe-().
analyzed: rāja ādīhi yayuva ādīhi ca sissa ā hoti rājā yayuvārāja brahma sakha atta ātuma  dhammaḥ vā aññatthe
translated: The forms rājā, rājaṃ, yuvā, yuvaṃ are used by kings, etc., and young men, etc., with the pupil, the king, the young man, the friend, the self, the body.

original: Daḷhadhammā; (daḷhadhammo) asmā.🔽Imo bhāve-().🔽Aṇimā, laghimā–-yuva sā suvā maghava puma vattaha.
analyzed: daḷha dhammā daḷha dhammaḥ asmai  imaḥ bhāve  aṇimā laghimā āyuva sā suvā maghava puma
translated: The forms dhammo, vāññatthe, daḷhadhammā, daḷhadhammo are used in the sense of ‘law’, ‘in any sense’, ‘firm law’, ‘firm in law’.

original: Vāmbhānaddha -.🔽Rājādīnaṃ yuvādīnaṃ cānaṅi hoti vāmhi; [ ] rājānaṃ, rājaṃ, yuvānaṃ, yuvaṃ.🔽Yonamāno-.🔽Rājādīhi yuvādīhi ca yonamāno vā hoti; rājāno, yuvāno–-vātveva-rājā,rāje, yuvā, yuve.🔽Āyo no ca sakhā-.
analyzed: vāmbhānaddha  rāja ādīnam yuva ādīnam ca anaṅi hoti vāmhi rājānam rājam yuvānam yuvam  yonamānaḥ  rāja adīhi yuva adīhi ca vā hoti rājānaḥ yuvānaḥ uvātu eva rājā arāje yuvā yuve  āyaḥ naḥ ca sakhā
translated: The forms asmā, bhāve, aṇimā, laghimā, yuva, sā, suvā, maghavā, pumā, vattaha are used in the sense of ‘from this’, ‘in the future’, ‘minuteness’, ‘lightness’, ‘young man’, ‘she’, ‘well-spoken’, ‘possessing good fortune’, ‘man’, ‘to be done’.

original: Sakhato yonamāyono honti vā āno ca; sakhāyo, sakhino, sakhāno?Vātveva-sakhā, sakhe.🔽Ṭe smino-.🔽Sakhato smino ṭe hoti; sakhe niccattho’yamārambho.🔽Nonāsesvi-.🔽Sakhassa i hoti nonāsesu; sakhino, sakhinā, sakhissa.🔽Smānaṃsu vā-.
analyzed: sakhataḥ yonam āyonaḥ honti vai ca sakhāyaḥ sakhinaḥ sakhānaḥ uvātu eva sakhā sakhe 🔽ṭe sminaḥ 🔽sakhataḥ sminaḥ u se hoti sakhe niccatthaḥ ayam ārambhaḥ 🔽naḥ nāse svi 🔽sakhassa i hoti nonāsesu sakhino sakhinā sakhissa 🔽sma anaṃsu vā
translated: The forms vāmbhānaddha, rājādīnaṃ, yuvādīnaṃ, ānaṅi, yonamāno, āyo, no, ca, sakhā, ṭe, smino, nonāsesu, smānaṃsu, vā are used in the sense of ‘bent’, ‘of kings, etc., and young men, etc.’, ‘the pupil’, ‘the pupil is worshipping’, ‘the body’, ‘the body is not a friend’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘the friend’, ‘the friends’, ‘

original: Sakhassa vā i hotī smānaṃsu; sakhismā, sakhasmā, sakhīnaṃ, sakhānaṃ.
analyzed: sakhassa vai i hoti sakhismā sakhasmā sakhīnam sakhānam
translated: Sakhassa vā i hotī smānaṃsu; sakhismā, sakhasmā, sakhīnaṃ, sakhānaṃ.

original: Yosvaṃhisu cāraṅi-.
analyzed: yos vaṃ hi su cāraṅi
translated: Yosvaṃhisu cāraṅi-.

original: Sakhassa vā āraṅi hoti yosvaṃhisusmānaṃsu ca; sakhāro sakhāyo, sakhāresu, sakhesu,sakhāraṃ, sakhaṃ, sakhārehi, sakhehi, sakhārā, sakhārasmā, sakhārānaṃ, sakhānaṃ.
analyzed: sakhassa vai āraṅi hoti ca sakhāraḥ sakhāyaḥ sakhāresu sakhesu sakhāram sakham sakhārehi sakhehi sakhārā sakhārasmai sakhārānam sakhānam
translated: Sakhassa vā āraṅi hoti yosvaṃhisusmānaṃsu ca; sakhāro sakhāyo, sakhāresu, sakhesu, sakhāraṃ, sakhaṃ, sakhārehi, sakhehi, sakhārā, sakhārasmā, sakhārānaṃ, sakhānaṃ.

original: Latupitādinamase-.
analyzed: la tu pi ta ādi namase
translated: Latupitādinamase-.

original: Latuppaccayantānaṃ pitādīnaṃ cāraṅi bhoti sato’ññatra; kattāro, pitaro, kattāraṃ, pitaraṃ, kattārā, pitarā, kattari, pitari–-aseti-kiṃ?Kattuno, pituno.
analyzed: la tup paccaya antānam pitā ādīnam ca āraṅi bhoti sataḥ uññatra kattāraḥ pitaraḥ kattāram pitaram kattārā pitarā kattari
translated: Latuppaccayantānaṃ pitādīnaṃ cāraṅi bhoti sato’ññatra; kattāro, pitaro, kattāraṃ, pitaraṃ, kattārā, pitarā, kattari, pitari–-aseti-kiṃ?Kattuno, pituno.

original: Namhi vā-.
analyzed: namhi vā
translated: Namhi vā-.

original: Namhi latupitādīnamāraṅi vā hoti; kattārānaṃ, kattunaṃ, pitarānaṃ, pitunnaṃ.
analyzed: namhi latu pita ādīnam āraṅi vā hoti kattārānam kattunam pitarānam
translated: Namhi latupitādīnamāraṅi vā hoti; kattārānaṃ, kattunaṃ, pitarānaṃ, pitunnaṃ.

analyzed: ā

original: Namhi latupitādīnamā vā hoti; kattānaṃ, kattūnaṃ, pitānaṃ, pitunnaṃ.
analyzed: namhi latu pita ādīnamā vā hoti kattānam kattūnam pitānam pitunnam
translated: Namhi latupitādīnamā vā hoti; kattānaṃ, kattūnaṃ, pitānaṃ, pitunnaṃ.

original: Salopo-.
analyzed: sa lopaḥ
translated: Salopo-.

original: Latupitādīhi sassa lopo vā hoti; kattu, kattuno, sakamandhātu, sakamandhātuno, pitu, pituno.
analyzed: latu pita ādīhi sassa lopaḥ vā hoti kattu kattuno sakamandhātu sakamandhātuno pitu pituno
translated: Latupitādīhi sassa lopo vā hoti; kattu, kattuno, sakamandhātu, sakamandhātuno, pitu, pituno.

original: Suhisvāraṅi-.
analyzed: su hi svāraṅi
translated: Suhisvāraṅi-.

original: Suhisu latupitādīnamaraṅi vā hoti; kattāresu, kattusu, pitaresu, pitusu, kattārehi, kattuhi, pitarehi, pituhi.
analyzed: su hi su latu pita ādīnam araṅi vā hoti kattāresu kattusu pitaresu pitusu kattārehi kattuhi pitarehi pituhi
translated: Suhisu latupitādīnamaraṅi vā hoti; kattāresu, kattusu, pitaresu, pitusu, kattārehi, kattuhi, pitarehi, pituhi.

original: Najjāyosvāma-.
analyzed: nat jāyā usvāma
translated: Najjāyosvāma-.

original: Yosu nadīsaddassa āmi vā hoti; najjāyo, nadiyo.
analyzed: yosu nadī saddassa āmi vā hoti nadiyaḥ
translated: Yosu nadīsaddassa āmi vā hoti; najjāyo, nadiyo.

original: Ṭi katimhā-.
analyzed: ṭi katimhā
translated: Ṭi katimhā-.

original: Katimhā yonaṃ ṭi hoti; kati tiṭṭhanti, kati passa.
analyzed: katimhā yonam ṭi hoti kati tiṭṭhanti kati passa
translated: Katimhā yonaṃ ṭi hoti; kati tiṭṭhanti, kati passa.

original: Ṭa pañcādihi cuddasahi-.
analyzed: ṭa pañca ādihi cut dasahi
translated: Ṭa pañcādihi cuddasahi-.

original: Pañcādīhi cuddasahi saṃkhyāhi yonaṃ ṭo hoti; pañca pañca, evaṃ yāva aṭṭhārasā–-pañcādīhīki-kiṃ? Dve tayo cattāro; cuddasabhīti-kiṃ? Dvevīsatiyo.
analyzed: saṃkhyāhi ṭaḥ hoti pañca pañca evam dve tayaḥ cattāraḥ dve vīsatiyaḥ
translated: Pañcādīhi cuddasahi saṃkhyāhi yonaṃ ṭo hoti; pañca pañca, evaṃ yāva aṭṭhārasā–-pañcādīhīki-kiṃ? Dve tayo cattāro; cuddasabhīti-kiṃ? Dvevīsatiyo.

original: Ubhagohi ṭo-.
analyzed: ubhagaḥ hi ṭaḥ
translated: Ubhagohi ṭo-.

original: Ubhagohi yonaṃ ṭo hoti; ubho, ubho, gāvo, gāvo–-kathaṃ? Imekarattiṃ ubhayo vasāmāti- ṭomhi yakārāgamo.
analyzed: ubhagohi ṭaḥ hoti ubhau ubhau gāvaḥ gāvaḥ katham imā eka rattim ubhayaḥ vasāma ati yakāra āgamaḥ
translated: Ubhagohi yonaṃ ṭo hoti; ubho, ubho, gāvo, gāvo–-kathaṃ? Imekarattiṃ ubhayo vasāmāti- ṭomhi yakārāgamo.

original: Āraṅismā-.
analyzed: āraṅi smā
translated: Āraṅismā-.

original: Āraṅādesato paresaṃ yonaṃ ṭo hoti; sakhāro, kattāro, pataro.
analyzed: āraṅ ādesataḥ paresam yonam ṭaḥ hoti sakhāraḥ kattāraḥ pataraḥ
translated: Āraṅādesato paresaṃ yonaṃ ṭo hoti; sakhāro, kattāro, pataro.

original: Ṭoṭe vā-.
analyzed: ṭa uṭe vā
translated: Ṭoṭe vā-.

original: Āraṅādesamhā yonaṃ ṭoṭe vā honti yathākkamaṃ; sakhāro, sakhāre, sakhāro–-ṭoggahaṇaṃ lāghavatthaṃ.🔽Ṭā nāsmānaṃ-.🔽Āraṅādesamhā nāsmānaṃ ṭā hoti; kattārā, kattārā, kvaci vā hoti bahakulādhikārā; etādisā sakhārasmā
analyzed: āraṅ ādesamhā yonam ṭoṭe vā honti yathākkamam sakhāraḥ sakhāroṭa uggahaṇam lāghava attham  ṭāḥ na asmānam  hoti kattārā kattārā kvaci vā hoti baha kula adhikārā
translated: The forms of the words sakhāro, sakhāre, sakhāro are the light forms of the words sakhāro, sakhāre, sakhāro, which are the heavy forms of the words sakhāro, sakhāre, sakhāro.🔽The forms of the words nāsmānaṃ, nāsmānaṃ, nāsmānaṃ are the light forms of the words asmānaṃ, asmānaṃ, asmānaṃ, which are the heavy forms of the words nāsmānaṃ, nāsmānaṃ, nāsmānaṃ.

original: Ṭi smino-.
analyzed: ṭi sminaḥ
translated: The forms of the words kattārā, kattārā, kvaci vā are the light forms of the words kattāro, kattāro, which are the heavy forms of the words kattārā, kattārā.

original: Āraṅādesamhā smino ṭi hoti; kattari, pitari.🔽Divādito-.
analyzed: āraṅ āde samhā sminaḥ ṭi hoti kattari pitari  divā ā t itaḥ
translated: The forms of the words kattari, pitari are the light forms of the words kattāro, pitāro, which are the heavy forms of the words kattari, pitari.

original: Divādīhi nāmehi smino ṭi hoti; divi, bhuvi–-niccaṃ vakārāgamo.🔽Rassāraṅi-.🔽Smimhi āro rasso hoti; kattari, nattari.🔽Pitādīnamanattvādīnaṃ-.
analyzed: div ādīhi nāmehi sminaḥ ṭi hoti divi bhuvi niccam vakāra āgamaḥ  ras sāraṅi  smimhi āraḥ rassaḥ hoti kattari nattari  pitā ādīnam anattvā adīnam
translated: The forms of the words divi, bhuvi are the light forms of the words divā, bhūmi, which are the heavy forms of the words divi, bhuvi.🔽The forms of the words kattari, nattari are the light forms of the words kattāro, nattāro, which are the heavy forms of the words kattari, nattari.

original: Nattvādivajjitānaṃ pitādīnamāro rasso hoti sabbāsu vibhattisu; pitaro, pitaraṃ–-anattvādīnanti kiṃ? Nattāro.🔽Yuvādīnaṃ suhisvānaṅi-.
analyzed: nattu ādi vat jitānam pitā ādīnam āraḥ rassaḥ hoti sabbāsu vibhattisu pitaraḥ kim nattāraḥ  yuva ādīnam su hi sva anaṅi
translated: The forms of the words pitaro, pitaraṃ are the light forms of the words pitāro, pitaraṃ, which are the heavy forms of the words pitaro, pitaraṃ.

original: Suhisu yuvādīnaṃ ānaṅi hoti; yayuvānesu, yuvānehi.🔽Nonānesvā-.🔽Esu yuvādīnamā hoti; yuvāno, yuvānā, yuvāne.
analyzed: su hi su yuva ādīnam ānaṅi hoti yayuvānesu yuvānehi  na u nāne svā  yuvānaḥ yuvānā yuvāne
translated: The forms of the words yayuvānesu, yuvānehi are the light forms of the words yuvānesu, yuvānehi, which are the heavy forms of the words yayuvānesu, yuvānehi.

original: Smāsminnaṃ nāne-.
analyzed: sma asminnam nāne
translated: The forms of the words yuvāno, yuvānā, yuvāne are the light forms of the words yuvānesu, yuvānehi, which are the heavy forms of the words yuvāno, yuvānā, yuvāne.

original: Yuvādīhiṃ smāsminnaṃ nāne honti yathākkamaṃ; yuvānā, yuvāne.
analyzed: yuvādīhim sma asminnam nāne honti yathākkamam yuvānā yuvāne
translated: The forms of yuvā, etc., are different in the three genders, as follows: yuvā, yuvāne, yuvāno;

original: Yonaṃ none vā-.
analyzed: yonam na ūne vā
translated: yonaṃ, none, vā-.

original: Yuvādīhi yonaṃ none vā honti yathākkamiṃ; yuvāno yuvāne–-vāti-kiṃ?Yuve passa;noggahaṇaṃ lāghavatthaṃ.
analyzed: yuva ādīhi yonam na ūne vā honti yathākkamim yuvānaḥ yuvānā iva atikiṃyuve passanā uggahaṇam lāghava attham
translated: The forms of yuvā, etc., are different in the three genders, as follows: yuvāno, yuvāne, yuvāno; vā-what? yuve passa; the omission of the final -o is for the sake of lightness.

original: Ito’ññatthe pume-.
analyzed: i taḥ ña tthe pume
translated: In other-than-masculine-gender-meaning.

original: Aññapadatthe vattamānā ikārantato nāmasmā yonaṃ none vā honti yathākkamaṃ pulliṅge, tomaraṃkusa pāṇino, tomaraṃkusapāṇine, vātveva-tomaraṃkusapāṇayo; aññattheti-kiṃ?Pāṇayo.
analyzed: añña pada atthe vattamānāḥ ikāra antataḥ nāmasmai ya ūnam na ūne vā honti yathākkamam pulliṅge tomaraṃkusa pāṇino tomaraṃkusa pāṇine aññattha iti kiṃpāṇayo
translated: When occurring in the meaning of another part of speech, the forms yonaṃ, none, vā, of the noun ending in -i are different in the three genders, as follows: tomaraṃkusa pāṇino, tomaraṃkusapāṇine, vātveva-tomaraṃkusapāṇayo; in other-than-masculine-gender-meaning-what? pāṇayo.

original: Ne smino kvavi-.
analyzed: ne sminaḥ kva vi
translated: Ne smino kvavi-.

original: Aññapadatthe vattamānā ikārantato nāmasmā smino ne hoti vā kvaci;’ kataññumhi ca posamhi sīlavante ariyavuttine’ vātveva-ariyavuttimhi; pumetveva-ariyayavuttiyā.
analyzed: añña pada tthe vattamānāḥ ikāra antataḥ nāmasmā sminaḥ ne hoti vā kvaci kataññumhi ca posamhi sīlavante ariya vuttine vā etveva ariya vuttimhi
translated: When occurring in the meaning of another part of speech, the forms yonaṃ, none, vā, of the noun ending in -i are different in the three genders, as follows: kataññumhi ca posamhi sīlavante ariyavuttine vātveva-ariyavuttimhi; in other-than-masculine-gender-meaning-what? ariyayavuttiyā.

original: Pumā-.
analyzed: pumā
translated: Pumā-.

original: Pumasaddato smino yaṃ vuttaṃ taṃ vā hoti; pumānepume.
analyzed: puma saddāt sminaḥ yam vuttam tam vā hoti pumān epume
translated: What was said of smino is also so of yaṃ of pumā-; pumānepume.

original: Nāmhi-.
analyzed: na amhi
translated: Nāmhi-.

original: Pumassa nāmhi yaṃ vuttaṃ taṃ vā hoti; pumānā pumena.
analyzed: pumassa nāmhi yam vuttam tam vā hoti pumānā pumena
translated: What was said of smino is also so of yaṃ of pumassa; pumānā pumena.

original: Sumhā ca-.
analyzed: sumhā ca
translated: And sumhā ca-.

original: Pumassa sumhi yaṃ vuttaṃ taṃ ā ca vā hoti; pumānesu, pumesu, pumāsu.
analyzed: pumassa sumhi yam vuttam tam ā ca vā hoti pumānesu pumesu pumāsu
translated: What was said for a male is also for a male in the plural, a male in the dual, and a male in the plural.

original: Gassaṃ-.
analyzed: gassam
translated: Gassaṃ-.

original: Pumasaddato gassa aṃ vā hoti; bho pumaṃ, bho puma, bho itthipumaṃ, bho itthipuma.
analyzed: puma saddataḥ gassa aṃ vā hoti bho pumam bho puma bho itthi pumam bho itthi puma
translated: After the word for a male, gassaṃ or aṃ is optionally added: bho pumaṃ, bho puma, bho itthipumaṃ, bho itthipuma.

original: Sāssaṃse cānaṅi-.
analyzed: sās saṃse ca anaṅi
translated: Sāssaṃse cānaṅi-.

original: Sāsaddassa ānaṅi hoti aṃse ge ca; sānaṃ, sānassa, bho sāna.
analyzed: sā saddassa ānaṅi hoti aṃse ge ca sānam sānassa bho sāna
translated: After the word for a male, ānaṅi is added to aṃsa, and ge is added: sānaṃ, sānassa, bho sāna.

original: Vattahā sanannaṃ nonānaṃ-.
analyzed: vattahā sanannam nonānam
translated: Vattahā sanannaṃ nonānaṃ-.

original: Vattahā sanannaṃ nonānaṃ honti yathākkama; vattahā no, vattahānānaṃ.
analyzed: vattahā sanannam nonānam honti yathākkama vattahā no vattahānānam
translated: Vattahā is added to sanannaṃ and nonānaṃ, respectively: vattahā no, vattahānānaṃ.

original: Brahmassu vā-.
analyzed: brahmassu vā
translated: Brahmassu vā-.

original: Brahmassu vā hoti sanaṃsu; brahmuno, brahmassa, brahmūnaṃ brahmānaṃ.
analyzed: brahmassu vā hoti sanaṃsu brahmunaḥ brahmassa brahmūnam brahmānam
translated: After the word for a male, vā is added to sanaṃsu: brahmuno, brahmassa, brahmūnaṃ brahmānaṃ.

original: Nāmhi-.
analyzed: na amhi
translated: Nāmhi-.

original: Brahmassu hoti nāmhi; brahmunā,
analyzed: brahmassu hoti nāmhi brahmunā
translated: After the word for a male, nāmhi is added: brahmunā,

original: Pumakammathāmaddhānaṃ vā sasmāsu ca-.
analyzed: vā sa smāsu ca
translated: Pumakammathāmaddhānaṃ vā sasmāsu ca-.

original: Pudīnamu hoti vā sasmāsu nāmhi ca; pumuno, pumassa; pumunā, pumānā, pumunā, pumānā;
analyzed: hoti vā sa smāsu nāmhi ca pumunā pumassa pumunā pumānā pumunā pumānā
translated: Pudīnamu is added optionally to sasmāsu and nāmhi: pumuno, pumassa; pumunā, pumānā, pumunā, pumānā;

original: kammuno, kammassa; kammunā kammasmā; kammunā, kammanā; ṭhāmuno, ṭhāmassa;ṭhāmunā,
analyzed: kammunā kammassa kammunā kammasmā kammunā kammanā ṭhāmunā ṭhāmassa ṭhāmunā
translated: kammuno, kammassa; kammunā kammasmā; kammunā, kammanā; ṭhāmuno, ṭhāmassa;ṭhāmunā,

original: ṭhāmasmā; ṭhāmunā, ṭhāmena; addhuno, addhassa; addhunā, addhasmā;addhunā, addhanā.
analyzed: ṭhāmasmai ṭhāmunā ṭhāmena addhunaḥ addhassa addhunā addhasmā addhunā addhanā
translated: from ṭhāna, ṭhāmunā, ṭhāmena; from addha, addhunā, addhasmā, addhunā, addhanā.

original: Yuvā sassano-.
analyzed: yuvā sassanaḥ
translated: Yuvā sassano.

original: Yuvā sassavā ino hoti, yuvino, yuvassa.
analyzed: yuvā inaḥ hoti yuvinaḥ yuvassa
translated: Yuvā sassavā ino hoti, yuvino, yuvassa.

original: Nottātumā-.
analyzed: na uttātumā
translated: Nottātumā.

original: Attātumehi sassa no hoti vā; attano, attassa; ātumano, ātumassa.
analyzed: atta ātumehi sassa no hoti vā attanaḥ attassa ātumanaḥ ātumassa
translated: Attātumehi sassa no hoti vā; attano, attassa; ātumano, ātumassa.

original: Suhisu naka-.
analyzed: su hi su naka
translated: Suhisu naka.

original: Attaātumānaṃ suhisu vā naka hoti; attanesu, attesu, ātumanesu, ātumesu; attanehi, attehi; ātumanehi, ātumehi–-kathaṃ?Verinesūti-naka iti yogavibhāgā.
analyzed: vā hoti attanesu attesu ātumanesu ātumesu attanehi attehi ātumanehi ātumehi katham vā iri nesūti nakaḥ iti yogavibhāgāḥ
translated: Attaātumānaṃ suhisu vā naka hoti; attanesu, attesu, ātumanesu, ātumesu; attanehi, attehi; ātumanehi, ātumehi—how? Verinesū ti naka iti yogavibhāgā.

original: Smāssanā brahmā ca-.
analyzed: brahmā ca
translated: Smāssanā brahmā ca.

original: Brahma attaātumehi ca smāssa nā hoti; brahmunā, attanā, ātumanā.
analyzed: brahma attaātumehi ca smā assa nā hoti brahmunā attanā ātumanā
translated: Brahma attaātumehi ca smāssa nā hoti; brahmunā, attanā, ātumanā.

original: Imetānamenāṇvādese dutiyāyaṃ-.
analyzed: dutiya ayam
translated: Imetānamenāṇvādese dutiyāyaṃ.

original: Imaetasaddānaṃ kathitānukathanavisaye dutiyāyamenādeso hoti; imaṃ bhikkhuṃ vinayamajjhāpayaatho
analyzed: kathita anukathana visaye hoti imam bhikkhum
translated: Imetādisaddānaṃ kathitānukathanavisaye dutiyāyamenādeso hoti; imaṃ bhikkhuṃ vinayamajjhāpayaatho

original: enaṃ dhammamajjhāpaya, ime bhikkhū vinayamajjhāpaya atho ene dhammamajjhāpaya; evame tassa ca yojanīyaṃ.
analyzed: enam dhammam ajjhāpaya ime bhikkhū vinayam ajjhāpaya atho ene dhammam ajjhāpaya evame tassa ca yojanīyam
translated: enaṃ dhammamajjhāpaya, ime bhikkhū vinayamajjhāpaya atho ene dhammamajjhāpaya; evame tassa ca yojanīyaṃ.

original: Kissa ko sabbāsu-.
analyzed: kissa kaḥ sabbāsu
translated: What is the ending in all?

original: Sabbāsu vibhattisukissako hoti; ko, ke, kā, kāyo, kaṃ, kāni, keneccādi.
analyzed: sabbāsu vibhattisu kissakaḥ hoti kaḥ ke kā kāyaḥ kam kāni kena iccādi
translated: The ending is kissa in all cases; ko, ke, kā, kāyo, kaṃ, kāni, kenaci, etc.

original: Ki sasmiṃsuvānitthiyaṃ-.
analyzed: ki sasmiṃsuvān itthiyam
translated: What is the ending in sasmiṃ, etc., when there is no feminine?

original: Anitthiyaṃ kissa ki vā hoti sasmiṃsu; kissa, kassa, kismiṃ, kasmiṃ; anitthiyanti-kiṃ? Ko, kaṃ.
analyzed: anitthiyam kissa ki vā hoti kissa kassa kismin kasmin
translated: The ending is kissa or ki in sasmiṃ, etc., when there is no feminine; kissa, kassa, kismiṃ, kasmiṃ. When there is a feminine? What? Ko, kaṃ.

original: Imassidaṃ vā-.
analyzed: vā
translated: This is its ending in amhi, etc.

original: Aṃsisu saha tehiimassidaṃ hoti vā napuṃsake; idaṃ, imaṃ; idaṃ,imaṃ.
analyzed: aṃsisu saha hoti vā napuṃsake idam imam idam imam
translated: The ending is idaṃ or imaṃ in amhi, etc., when there is no neuter; idaṃ, imaṃ.

original: Amussāduṃ-.
analyzed: amussādum
translated: This is its aduṃ in amussa, etc.

original: Aṃsisu saha tehi amussa aduṃ hoti vā napuṃsake; aduṃ, amuṃ; aduṃ, amuṃ.
analyzed: aṃsisu saha tehi amussa adum hoti vā napuṃsake adum amum adum amum
translated: The ending is aduṃ or amuṃ in amussa, etc., when there is no neuter; aduṃ, amuṃ; aduṃ, amuṃ.

original: Sumbhāmbhassāsmā-
analyzed: sumbha ambhaḥ sā asmai
translated: In sum, bhattī is from asmā.

original: Ahmassa asmā hoti vā sumhi; bhattīrasmāsu sā tava; vātveva-amhesu.🔽Namhi ticatuntamitthiyaṃ tissacatassā-.
analyzed: ahmassa asmā hoti vā sumhi bhattīḥ asmāsu sā tava vātu eva amhesu  namhi ti catuntam itthiyam tissa catassā
translated: The ending is asmā in sum, bhattī is from asmā in asmāsu; tava in vātveva; amhesu.🔽In namhi, ticatuntam, itthiyaṃ, tissacatassā.

original: Namhi ticatunnaṃ tissavatassā hontitthiyaṃ yathākkamaṃ; tissannaṃ, vatassannaṃ; itthiyanti-kiṃ? Tiṇṇaṃ, catunnaṃ.
analyzed: namhi ti catunnam tissa vatassāḥ honti itthiyam yathākkamam tissannam vatassannam tiṇṇam catunnam
translated: The endings are tissavatassā in namhi, ticatuntam, itthiyaṃ, in that order; tissannaṃ, vatassannaṃ. When there is no feminine? What? Tiṇṇaṃ, catunnaṃ.

original: Tissocatasso yomhi savibhattīnaṃ-. Vibhattisahitānaṃ tivatunnaṃ yomhi tisso catasso hontitthiyaṃ yathākkamaṃ; tisso,catasso
analyzed: tissaḥ catassaḥ yomhi sa vibhattīnam vibhatti sahitānam tiva tunnam yomhi tissaḥ catassaḥ honti itthiyam yathākkamam tissaḥ catassaḥ
translated: I am three or four of the declensions with case endings.

original: Tīṇicattāri napuṃsake-.🔽Yomhisavibhattīnaṃ ticatunnaṃ yathākkamaṃtīṇi cattāri honti napuṃsake; tīṇi, cattāri.🔽Pume tayocattāro-.
analyzed: tīṇi cattāri napuṃsake  ti catunnam yathākkamaṃtīṇi cattāri honti napuṃsake tīṇi cattāri  pume tayocattāraḥ
translated: Three or four in the neuter.🔽Three or four in the neuter.🔽In the masculine, they are three or four.

original: Yomhi savibhattīnaṃ ticatunnaṃ tayocattāro honti yathākkamaṃ pulliṅge; tayo, cattāro.
analyzed: sa vibhattīnam ti catunnam tayocattāraḥ honti yathākkamam pul liṅge tayo cattāraḥ
translated: In the masculine, they are three or four.

original: Caturovā catussa-.
analyzed: catur uvā catuḥ sa
translated: Four or four in the masculine.🔽Four or four in the masculine.

original: Catusaddassa savibhattissa yombhi caturo vā hoti pulliṅge; caturo janā saṃvidhāya; kathaṃ? Caturo nimittenāddasāsinti liṅgavipallāsā.🔽Mayamasmāmhassa-.
analyzed: catu saddassa sa vibhattissa caturaḥ vā hoti pulliṅge caturaḥ janā saṃvidhāya katham caturaḥ liṅga vipallāsā  maya mas mā amhassa
translated: We are of the declension with case endings.🔽We are of the declension with case endings.

original: Yeyāsvamhassa savibhattissaasmākaṃmamaṃ honti vā yathākkamaṃ; asmākaṃ, amhākaṃ; mamaṃ, mama.🔽Simbhahaṃ-.
analyzed: yeyāsu amhassa sa vibhattissa asmākam mamam honti vā yathākkamam asmākam amhākam mamam mamam  simbhahaṃ
translated: I am of the declension with case endings.🔽I am of the declension with case endings.

original: Simhi amhassa savibhattissa ahaṃ hoti; ahaṃ.
analyzed: simhi amhassa sa vibhattissa aham hoti aham
translated: You are of the declension with case endings.

original: Tumhassa tuvaṃtvamamhi ca-.
analyzed: tumhassa tuvam tvam amhi ca
translated: You are of the declension with case endings.

original: Amhī simhi ca tuhmassa savibhattissa tuvaṃtvaṃ honti yathākkamaṃ; tuvaṃ, tvaṃ.
analyzed: amhi simhi ca tuhmassa sa vibhattissa tuvam tvam honti yathākkamam tuvam tvam
translated: Amhi, simhi, and tuhassa with case-ending are tuvam and tuvaṃ respectively.

original: Tayātayīnaṃ tvaṃ vā tassa-.
analyzed: tayātayīnam tvam vā tassa
translated: Tayātayīnaṃ is tvaṃ or tassa.

original: Tumhassatayātayīnaṃ takārassatva hoti vā; tvayā, tayā; tvayi, tayi.
analyzed: tumhaḥ sa tayā tayīnam takāraḥ sa tva hoti vā tvayā tayā tvayi tayi
translated: Tumhassatayātayīnaṃ is takārassatva or hoti.

original: Smāmhi tvamhā-.
analyzed: sma amhi tvamhā
translated: Smāmhi and tvamhā-.

original: Smāmhi tumhassa savibhattissa tvamhā hoti vā; pattā nissaṃsayaṃ [ ] tvamhā–-vātveva-tvayā.
analyzed: sma āmhi tumhassa sa vibhattissa tvamhā hoti vā pattā nissaṃsayam
translated: Smāmhi and tumhassa with case-ending are tvamhā or hoti.

original: Ntantunaṃ nto yomhi paṭhame-.
analyzed: ntantunam ntaḥ yomhi paṭhame
translated: Ntantunaṃ is nto yomhi in the first.

original: Paṭhame yomhi ntantunaṃ savibhattinaṃ nto iccādeso vā hoti; gacchanto, gacchantā; guṇavanto, guṇavantā.
analyzed: paṭhame sa vibhattinam nto i ca ādesaḥ vā hoti gacchantaḥ gacchantā guṇavantaḥ guṇavantā
translated: In the first, nto is the substitute for ntantunaṃ with case-ending or hoti.

original: Taṃ namhi-.
analyzed: tam namhi
translated: Taṃ namhi-.

original: Namhi ntantunaṃ savibhattinaṃ taṃ vā hoti; gacchataṃ, gacchantānaṃ; guṇavataṃ, guṇavantānaṃ.
analyzed: namhi n tantunam sa vibhattinam tam vā hoti gacchatam gacchantānam guṇavatam guṇavantānam
translated: Namhi is taṃ or hoti for ntantunaṃ with case-ending.

original: Totātitā sasmāsmiṃnāsu-.
analyzed: tota atitā sasma asmin nāsu
translated: Totātitā is sasmāsmiṃnāsu-.

original: Sādisuntantunaṃ savibhattinaṃ totātitā honti vā yathākkamaṃ; gacchato, gacchantassa;
analyzed: sa ādi suntantunam honti vā yathākkamam gacchataḥ gacchantassa
translated: Totātitā are for sādisuntantunaṃ with case-ending or yathākkamaṃ.

original: guṇavato, guṇavantassa; gacchatā, gacchantamhā; guṇavatā, guṇavantamhā; gacchati,
analyzed: guṇavataḥ guṇavantassa gacchatā gacchantamhā guṇavatā guṇavantamhā gacchati
translated: Of one who has qualities, of one who has qualities; by one who goes, by one who goes; by one who has qualities, by one who has qualities; to one who goes,

original: gacchante;guṇavati, guṇavante; gacchatā, gacchantena; guṇavatā, guṇavantena.🔽Ṭaṭāaṃ ge-.
analyzed: gacchante guṇavati guṇavante gacchatā gacchantena guṇavatā guṇavantena  ṭa ṭā am ge
translated: to one who goes; to one who has qualities, to one who has qualities; by one who goes, by one who goes; by one who has qualities, by one who has qualities.

original: Ge pare ntantunaṃ savibhattīnaṃ ṭaṭāaṃ iccādesā honti; bho gaccha, bho gacchā, bhoka gacchaṃ; bho guṇava, bho guṇavā, bho guṇavaṃ.🔽Yomhi dvinnaṃ duveñce-.
analyzed: ge pare sa vibhattīnam ṭa ṭāam i t ca ādesāḥ honti bho gaccha bho gacchā bhoka gaccham bho guṇava bho guṇavā bho guṇavam  yomhi dvinnam duveñce
translated: The endings ṭā, aṃ, and ge are substituted for the case endings of the bases ending in a vowel.

original: Yomhi dvissa savibhattissa duvedve honti paccekaṃ; duve, dve.🔽Duvinnaṃ namhi vā-.
analyzed: dvissa savibhattissa duve dve honti paccekam duve dve  du vinnam namhi vā
translated: The endings duve and dve are substituted for the case endings of the dual.

original: Namhi dvissa savibhattissa duvinnaṃ hoti vā; duvinnaṃ, dvinnaṃ.🔽Rājassa raññaṃ-.
analyzed: na mhi dvissa savibhattissa duvinnam hoti vā duvinnam dvinnam  rājassa raññam
translated: The ending duvinnaṃ is substituted for the case endings of the dual.

original: Namhi rājasaddassasavibhattissaraññaṃ hoti vā; raññaṃ, rajānaṃ🔽Nāsmāsu raññā-.🔽Nāsmāsu rājassa savibhattissaraññā hoti, raññā kataṃ, raññānissaṭaṃ.
analyzed: na mhi rāja saddassa sa vibhattissa raññam hoti vā raññam rajānam  na asmāsu raññā  na asmāsu rājassa sa vibhattissa raññā hoti raññā katam raññā nissaṭam
translated: The ending raññaṃ is substituted for the case endings of the base rājā.🔽The ending raññā is substituted for the case endings of the base rājā.

original: Raññoraññassarājino se-.
analyzed: raññoḥ raññassa rājinaḥ se
translated: The ending rañño is substituted for the case endings of the base rājā.

original: Se rājassa savibhattissa raññoraññassarājino hontī; rañño, raññassa, rājino.🔽Smimhi raññerājini-.
analyzed: se rājassa sa vibhattissa rañño raññassa rājinaḥ honti raññaḥ raññassa rājinaḥ  smimhi raññeḥ rājini
translated: They are the King’s, the King’s, the King’s, the King’s.🔽In the locative the forms are the King’s, the King’s.

original: Smimhi rājassa savibhattissa raññerājini honti; raññe,rājini.
analyzed: smimhi rājassa sa vibhattissa raññerājini honti raññerājini
translated: In the locative the forms are the King’s, the King’s.

original: Samāse vā-.
analyzed: samāse vā
translated: Or in a compound.

original: Samāsavisaye ete ādesā rājassavā honti; kāsiraññā, kāsirājena; kāsiraññā, kāsirājasmā; kāsirañño, kāsirājassa; kāsiraññe, kāsirāje.🔽Smimhi tumhāmhānaṃtayimayi-.🔽Smimhi tumhaamhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ tayimayi honti yathākkamaṃ; tayi,mayayi.
analyzed: samāsa visaye ete ādesāḥ rājassavā honti kāsiraññā kāsirājena kāsiraññā kāsirājasmā kāsirañño kāsirājassa kāsiraññe kāsirāje  smi mhi tumha amha anaṃtayi mayi  smi mhi tumha amha saddānam sa vibhattīnam tayi mayi honti yathākkamam tayi mayayi
translated: In a compound the forms are the King’s, the King’s, the King’s, the King’s, the King’s, the King’s.🔽In the locative of you and we the forms are this and that.

original: Amhi taṃmaṃtavaṃmamaṃ-.
analyzed: amhi taṃ maṃta vaṃ mamam
translated: In the locative of you and we the forms are this and that respectively.🔽In me the forms are that, that, your, my.

original: Amhi tumhaamhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ taṃmaṃtavaṃmamaṃ honti yathākkamaṃ; taṃ, maṃ, tavaṃ, mamaṃ.🔽Nāsmāsutayāmayā-.🔽Nāsmāsu tumhaamhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ tayāmayā honti yathākkamaṃ; tayā kataṃ, mayā kataṃ; tayā nissaṭaṃ, mayā nissaṭaṃ.
analyzed: amhi tumha amha saddānam sa vibhattīnam tam mam tavam mamam honti yathākkamam tam mam tavam mamam  na asmāsutayā amayā  na asmāsu tumha amha saddānam sa vibhattīnam tayā amayāḥ honti yathākkamam tayā katam mayā katam tayā nissaṭam mayā nissaṭam
translated: In me the forms are that, that, your, my respectively.🔽In us the forms are by you, by me.🔽In us the forms are by you, by me respectively.

original: Tavamamatuyhaṃmayhaṃ se-.
analyzed: tava ma ma tuyham mayham se
translated: In yours and mine the forms are yours, mine.

original: Setumhaamhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ tavamamatuyhaṃmayhaṃ honti yathākkamaṃ; tava, tuyhaṃ; mama,mayhaṃ.🔽Ṅaṃṅakaṃ namhi-.
analyzed: se tumha amha saddānam sa vibhattīnam tava mama tuyham mayham honti yathākkamam tava tuyham mama mayham  ṅam ṅakam namhi
translated: Tava, tuyhaṃ, mama, mayhaṃ are the forms of tava, tuyhaṃ, mama, mayhaṃ respectively with the case endings.🔽Ṅaṃṅakaṃ, namhi are the forms of ṅaṃṅakaṃ, namhi respectively with the case endings.

original: Namhi tumhaamhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ ṅaṃṅākaṃ honti paccekaṃ; tumhaṃ, tumhākaṃ, amhaṃ, amhākaṃ–-yathāsaṅkhyamatra na vivacchate.
analyzed: na mhi tumha amha saddānam sa vibhattīnam ṅam ṅākam honti paccekam tumham tumhākam amham amhākam yathāsaṅkhyam atra na vivacchate
translated: Tumhaṃ, tumhākaṃ, amhaṃ, amhākaṃ are the forms of tumhaṃ, tumhākaṃ, amhaṃ, amhākaṃ respectively with the case endings.

original: Dutiye yomhi vā-.
analyzed: dutiye yomhi vā
translated: Dutiye yomhi vā is the rule for the second case.

original: Tumhaamhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ paccekaṃ ṅaṃṅākaṃ vā honti yomhi dutiye; tumhaṃ’tumhākaṃ, tumhe; amhaṃ,amhākaṃ,amhe.
analyzed: tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam paccekam ṅaṃ ṅākam vā honti yo umhi dutiye tumham tumhākam tumhe amham amhākam amhe
translated: Tumhaṃ, tumhākaṃ, tumhe, amhaṃ, amhākaṃ, amhe are the forms of tumhaṃ, tumhākaṃ, amhaṃ, amhākaṃ, amhe respectively with the case endings.

original: Apādādo padatekavākye-.
analyzed: a pāda ādaḥ pada tā ikavākye
translated: Apādādo padatekavākye is the rule for the third case.

original: Idamadhikataṃ veditabbaṃ; pajjate’nenatthoti-padaṃ, syādyantaṃ tyādyāntañca; padasamūho vākyaṃ.
analyzed: idam adhikatam veditabbam pajjatena inattha iti padam pada samūhaḥ vākyam
translated: This should be understood as the additional rule: A word is that by which something is expressed. It may end in a syllable or it may not. A collection of words is a sentence.

original: Yonaṃhisvapañcamyā vono-.
analyzed: ya u nam hi sva pañcamyāḥ va ū naḥ
translated: Yonaṃhisvapañcamyā vono is the rule for the fifth case.

original: Apañcamiyā yonaṃhisvapādādo vattamānānaṃ padasmā paresaṃ ekavākye ṭhitānaṃ tumhaamhasaddānaṃ
analyzed: a pañcamiyāḥ vattamānānam padasma paresam eka vākye ṭhitānam tumha amha saddānam
translated: In a single sentence, the forms of tumhaṃ, tumhākaṃ, amhaṃ, amhākaṃ are used instead of the forms of tumhaṃ, tumhākaṃ, amhaṃ, amhākaṃ which occur in the fifth case and which are in the same word.

original: savibhattīnaṃ vo no honti vā yathākkamaṃ; tiṭṭhatha vo, tiṭṭhatha tumhe; tiṭṭhāma
analyzed: sa vibhattīnam vaḥ naḥ honti vā yathākkamam tiṭṭhatha vaḥ tiṭṭhatha tumhe tiṭṭhāma
translated: Are yours, or ours, respectively.🔽Stay you, stay you all; we stay, we all stay.🔽You see, you all see; we see, we all see.

original: no, tiṭṭhāma mayaṃ; passati vo, passati tumhe; passati no, passatiamhe; dīyate vo,
analyzed: no tiṭṭhāma mayam passati vaḥ passati tumhe passati no passati amhe dīyate vaḥ
translated: Is given to you, is given to you all; is given to us, is given to us all.

original: dīyate tumhaṃ; dīyate no,
analyzed: dīyate tumham dīyate no
translated: Is given to me, is given to me.🔽Wealth to you, wealth to you all; wealth to us, wealth to us all.🔽Done by you, done by you all; done by us, done by us all.🔽Without the fifth case?🔽Abandoned by you, abandoned by us.

original: Dīyate amhaṃ; dhanaṃ vo, dhanaṃ tumhaṃ; dhanaṃ no, dhanaṃ amhaṃ; kataṃ vo, kataṃ tumhehi; kataṃ no, kataṃ amhehi–-apañcamyāti-kiṃ?Nissaṭaṃ tumhehi, nissaṭaṃ amhehi; apādādotveva
analyzed: dīyate amham dhanam vaḥ dhanam tumham dhanam no dhanam amham katam vaḥ katam tumhehi katam no katam amhehi a pañcamyā ati kiṃnissaṭam tumhehi nissaṭam amhehi
translated: Without the ablative case?

original: “Balañca bhikkhūnamanuppadinnaṃ,
analyzed: balam ca bhikkhūnam an uppadinnam
translated: “The strength of the monks has been brought to bear,🔽You have made much merit.”

original: Tumhehi puññaṃ pasutaṃ anappakaṃ”;
analyzed: tumhehi puññam pasutam anappakam
translated: Without the locative case?🔽You stay, you all stay.🔽Without a sentence? Devadatta stays in the village, you stay in the town.🔽Without the sixth case?

original: Padatotveva- tumhe tiṭṭhatha; ekavākyetveva- devadatto tiṭṭhati gāme, tumhe tiṭṭhathanagare; savibhattīnaṃtveva- arahati dhammo tumhādinaṃ; arahati dhammo amhādisānaṃ.
analyzed: eka vākye tu eva tumhe tiṭṭhatha eka vākye tu eva devadatto tiṭṭhati gāme tumhe tiṭṭhatha nagare sa vibhattīnam tu eva arahati dhammo tumha ādinam arahati dhammo amha ādisānam
translated: The Dhamma is worthy of you, the Dhamma is worthy of us.

original: Teme nāse-.
analyzed: teme nāse
translated: These are the nasals.

original: Nāmhi se ca apādādo vattamānānaṃ padasmā paresaṃ eka vākye ṭhitānaṃ tumhaambhasaddānaṃ
analyzed: nāmhi se ca a pāda ādaḥ vattamānānam padasma paresam eka vākye ṭhitānam tumha ambha saddānam
translated: In the words of the present tense, in the same sentence, of the words tumhaṃ and amhaṃ,

original: savibhattīnaṃ teme vā honti yathākkamaṃ; kataṃ te, kataṃ tayā; kataṃme, kataṃ mayā;
analyzed: sa vibhattīnam te ime vā honti yathākkamam katam te katam tayā katam me katam mayā
translated: which are in the nominative case, the forms te and me come respectively,

original: dīyate te, dīyate tava; dīyate me, dīyayate mama; dhanaṃ te, dhanaṃme, dhanaṃ mama.
analyzed: dīyate te dīyate tava dīyate me dīyayate mama dhanam te dhanam me dhanam mama
translated: as in the following: kataṃ te, kataṃ tayā; kataṃ me, kataṃ mayā; dīyate te, dīyate tava; dīyate me, dīyate mama; dhanaṃ te, dhanaṃ me, dhanaṃ mama.

original: Anvādese-.
analyzed: anvādese
translated: In the optative mood.

original: Kathitānukathanavisaye tumhaamhasaddānamādesā niccaṃ bhavanti punabbidhānā; gāmo tumhaṃ pariggaho, atho janapado vo pariggaho.
analyzed: kathita anukathana visaye tumha amha saddānam ādesāḥ niccam bhavanti punabbidhānā gāmaḥ tumham pariggahaḥ atho janapadaḥ vo pariggahaḥ
translated: In the optative mood, the words tumhaṃ and amhaṃ are always used in the sense of the words tumhākaṃ and amhākaṃ, as in the following: gāmo tumhaṃ pariggaho, atho janapado vo pariggaho.

original: Sapubbā paṭhamantā vā-.
analyzed: sa pubbā paṭhama antā vā
translated: With the words paṭhaṃ and antā.

original: Vijjamānapubbasmā paṭhamantā paresaṃ tumhaamhasaddānamā desā vā honti anvādese’pi;🔽gāme paṭo tumhākaṃ, atho nagare kambalo vo; atho nagare kambalo tumhākaṃ; sapubbāti-kiṃ?
analyzed: vijjamāna pubba smā paṭhama antā paresam tumha amha sadda namāḥ desāḥ vā honti anvādese pi  gāme paṭaḥ tumhākam atho nagare kambalaḥ vaḥ atho nagare kambalaḥ tumhākam sa pubbātikim
translated: The words tumhaṃ and amhaṃ, which are used with the words paṭhaṃ and antā, are used in the optative mood, as in the following:🔽paṭo tumhākaṃ gāme, atho kambalo vo nagare; atho kambalo tumhākaṃ nagare.🔽With the words paṭhaṃ and antā. What is the form?

original: Paṭo tumhākaṃ, atho kambalo vo; paṭha mantāti-kiṃ-paṭo nagare tumhākaṃ, atho kambalo gāme vo.
analyzed: paṭaḥ tumhākam atho kambalaḥ vaḥ paṭha mantā atikiṃpaṭaḥ nagare tumhākam atho kambalaḥ gāme vaḥ
translated: paṭo tumhākaṃ, atho kambalo vo; paṭhaṃ antāti-kiṃ? paṭo nagare tumhākaṃ, atho kambalo gāme vo.

original: Na vavāhāhevayoge-.
analyzed: na vavāha aha iva yoge
translated: Not in the compound beginning with ‘vavāhahe’.

original: Cādīhi yoge tumhaamhasaddānamādesā na honti; gāmo tava ca pariggaho, mama ca pariggaho;
analyzed: ca ādīhi yoge tumha amha saddānam ādesāḥ na honti tava ca pariggahaḥ mama ca pariggahaḥ
translated: In the compound beginning with ‘ca’ the terminations of the words ‘tumha’ and ‘amha’ are not, viz. ‘gāmo tava ca pariggaho, mama ca pariggaho’,

original: gāmo tava vā pariggaho, mama vā pariggaho; gāmo tavaha pariggaho, mamaha pariggaho;
analyzed: gāmaḥ tava vā pariggahaḥ mama vā pariggahaḥ gāmaḥ pariggahaḥ mama ha pariggahaḥ
translated: ‘gāmo tava vā pariggaho, mama vā pariggaho’, ‘gāmo tavaha pariggaho, mamaha pariggaho’,

original: gāmo tavāha pariggaho, mamāha parigga ho; gāmā taveva pariggaho, mameva pariggaho;
analyzed: gāmaḥ tava āha pariggahaḥ mama āha pariggahaḥ gāmā tava iva pariggahaḥ mama iva pariggahaḥ
translated: ‘gāmo tavāha pariggaho, mamāha pariggaho’, ‘gāmo taveva pariggaho, mameva pariggaho’.

original: evaṃ sabbattha udāhararitabbaṃ–-yogeti kiṃ? Gāmoca te pariggaho, nagarañca me pariggaho.
analyzed: evam sabbattha te pariggahaḥ nagaram ca me pariggahaḥ
translated: Thus in all cases it should be illustrated. What is the compound? ‘Gāmo ca te pariggaho, nagarañca me pariggaho’.

original: Dassanatthenālocane-.
analyzed: dassana atthena ālocane
translated: In the locative in the sense of ‘seeing’.🔽In the locative in the sense of ‘seeing’ when used without the word ‘ālocanā’ the terminations of the words ‘tumha’ and ‘amha’ are not, viz. ‘gāmo tumhe uddissāgato’, ‘gāmo amhe uddissāgato’.

original: Dassanatthesu ālocanavajjitesu payujjamānesu tumha amhasaddānamādesā na honti; gāmo tumhe uddissāgato, gāmo amhe uddissāgato–-anālocaneti-kiṃ? Gāmo vo āloveti, gāmo no āloceti.
analyzed: dassana atthesu ālocana vajjitesu payujjamānesu tumha amha saddānam ādesāḥ na honti gāmo tumhe uddissa āgataḥ gāmaḥ amhe uddissa āgataḥ anālocanā iti kim gāmaḥ vaḥ āloveti gāmaḥ no āloca iti
translated: Without ‘seeing’—what? ‘Gāmo vo āloceti’, ‘gāmo no āloceti’.

original: Āmantaṇaṃ pubbamasantaṃva-.
analyzed: āmantaṇam pubbam a santam va
translated: The vocative is as if it were not there before.

original: Āmantaṇaṃ pubbamavijjamānaṃ viya hoti tumhaamhasaddāna mādesavisaye; devadatta tava
analyzed: āmantaṇam pubbam avijjamānam viya hoti tumha amha saddāna mā ādesa visaye devadatta tava
translated: In the sphere of the terminations of the words ‘tumha’ and ‘amha’ the vocative is as if it were not there before, viz. ‘devadatta tava’,

original: pariggaho–-āmantaṇantikiṃ? Kambalo te pariggaho; pubbanti-kiṃ?’Mayetaṃ sabba makkhātaṃ
analyzed: kambalaḥ te pariggahaḥ
translated: What is the meaning of ‘pariggaho’? ‘The blanket is your possession; what is the meaning of ‘pubba’? ‘May all this be explained to you, O you who are the chief of the twice-born.’

original: tumhākaṃ dvijapuṅgavā’ parassa hi [ ] avijjamānantā apādādoti-paṭisedhona siyā? Ivāti-kiṃ?
analyzed: tumhākam dvija puṅgavā parassa hi siyā iva atikim
translated: What is the meaning of ‘parassa’? ‘In the absence of another’s’ is the prohibition. What is the meaning of ‘ivā’?

original: Savanaṃ[ ] yathā siyā.
analyzed: savanam yathā siyā
translated: ‘As if’ is the meaning.

original: Na sāmaññavacanamekatthe-.
analyzed: na sāmañña vacanam ekatthe
translated: The word ‘sāmañña’ is not used in the singular.

original: Samānādhikaraṇe parato sāmaññavacanamāmantaṇamasantaṃ viya na hoti; māṇavaka jaṭilaka
analyzed: samāna adhikaraṇe paratas sāmañña vacanam āmantaṇam asantam viya na hoti māṇavaka jaṭilaka
translated: In the case of a common noun after a word in the nominative case, the word ‘sāmañña’ is not used as if it were absent; ‘O young brāhmaṇa, O young ascetic’

original: tepariggaho–-parassā vijjamānatte’pi pubbarūpamupādāyādeso hoti; sāmañña vacananti-kiṃ?
analyzed: te pariggahaḥ uparassa vijjamāna tte pi pubbarūpam upādāya ādesaḥ hoti sāmañña
translated: What is the meaning of ‘pariggaho’? ‘Even in the presence of another’s’ the word ‘pubba’ is used by way of a previous form; what is the meaning of ‘sāmañña’?

original: Devadatta māṇavaka tava pariggaho; ekatthetikiṃ? Devadatta yaññadatta tumhaṃ pariggaho.
analyzed: devadatta māṇavaka tava pariggahaḥ ekattha iti kim devadatta yaññadatta tumham pariggahaḥ
translated: ‘O Devadatta, young brāhmaṇa, your possession’ What is the meaning of ‘ekatthe’? ‘O Devadatta, O Yaññadatta, your possession.’

original: Bahusu vā-.
analyzed: bahusu vā
translated: What is the meaning of ‘bahusu’?

original: Bahusu vattamānamāmantaṇaṃ sāmaññavacanamekatthe avijjamānaṃ viya vā na hoti; brāhmaṇā guṇavanto tumhākaṃ pariggaho; brāhmaṇā guṇavanto vo pariggaho.
analyzed: bahusu vattamānam āmantaṇam sāmañña vacanam ekatthe a vijjamānam viya vā na hoti brāhmaṇāḥ guṇavantaḥ tumhākam pariggahaḥ brāhmaṇāḥ guṇavantaḥ vaḥ pariggahaḥ
translated: In the case of many, the word ‘sāmañña’ is used in the plural as if it were absent; ‘The brāhmaṇas are virtuous, your possession; the brāhmaṇas are virtuous, your possession.’

original: Iti moggallāne vyākaraṇe vuttiyaṃ syādikaṇḍo dutiyo.
analyzed: iti moggallāne vyākaraṇe vuttiyam syāt ikaṇḍaḥ dutiyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the second chapter in the commentary called “The Expositor.”

original: Syādi syādinekatthaṃ-.
analyzed: syādi syādinā ikattham
translated: Syādyantaṃ syādinekatthaṃ.

original: Syādyantaṃ syādyāntena sahekatthaṃ hotīti-idamadhikataṃ veditabbaṃ; so ca bhinnatthānamekatthibhāvo samāsoti vuccate.
analyzed: syādi antam syādi āntena saha ikattham hoti iti idam adhikatam veditabbam saḥ ca bhinna tthānam ekatthi bhāvo samāsaḥ iti vuccate
translated: It should be understood that the following is the additional matter: a word ending in syādyanta is of one meaning with another word ending in syādyanta. And that difference of meaning and identity of meaning is called a compound.

original: Asaṃkhyaṃ vibhattisampattisamīpasākalyābhāvayathā pacchāyugapadatthe-.
analyzed: asaṃkhyam vibhatti sampatti samīpa sākalya a bhāva yathā pacchā yuga pad atthe
translated: Asaṃkhyaṃ vibhattisampattisamīpasākalyābhāvayathā pacchāyugapadatthe.

original: Asaṃkhyaṃ syyādyantaṃ vibhatyādīnamatthe vattamānaṃ syādyantena sahekatthaṃ bhavati;
analyzed: asaṃkhyam syādi antam vattamānam syādi antena saha ikattham bhavati
translated: A word ending in syādyanta, which is not a numeral, is of one meaning with another word ending in syādyanta in the sense of the locative case, etc.,

original: tattha vibhatyatthe tāva-itthisu kathā pavattā adhitthi–-sampatti dvidhā attasampatti
analyzed: tattha kathā pavattā dvidhā
translated: Herein, first of all, as regards the locative case: the talk that occurs in women is adhitthi, the success of the self is twofold, success of the self,

original: samiddhi casampannaṃ brahmaṃ sabrahmaṃ, licchavīnaṃ; samiddhi bhikkhānaṃ subhikkhaṃ.
