translated: In advitte, vattamānassa, dā, daṃ, vā, hoti, mesu; dammi, demi; damma, dema. In añcitte, what is the purpose? Dadāmi, dadāma.

original: Karassa sossakuṃ-.
analyzed: karassa sossakum
translated: In karassa, so, kuṃ.

original: Karassa saokārassa kuṃ vā hoti mimesu; kummi, kumma; karomi, karoma.
analyzed: karassa saokārassa kum vā hoti mimesu kummi karomi karoma
translated: In karassa, sa, okārassa, kuṃ, vā, hoti, mesu; kummi, kumma; karomi, karoma.

original: Kā īādisu-.
analyzed: kā ī ādisu
translated: In kā, īādi.

original: Karassa saokārassakā hoti vā īādisu; akāsi, akari; akaṃsu, akariṃsu; akā, akarā.🔽Hāssacāhaṅi ssena-.🔽Karassasossahāssaca āhaṅi vā hoti ssena saha; kāhati, karissati; akāhā, akarissā;hāhatī, hāyissati; āhāhā, ahāyissā.
analyzed: karassa hoti vā ī ādisu akāsi akari akaṃsu akariṃsu akā akarā  hās sacā ahaṅi s sena  āhaṅi vā hoti ssena saha kāhati karissati akāhāḥ akarissā hāhatī hāyissati āhāhāḥ ahāyissā
translated: The form of the root is the same as that of the present tense in the verbs beginning with ‘okāsa’, ‘kāha’, etc., in the 3rd person singular, or in the 3rd person plural, or in the 2nd person singular.🔽The form of the root is the same as that of the future tense in the verbs beginning with ‘hāsa’, ‘hāha’, ‘āhaṅi’, ‘ssena’, ‘saha’.🔽The form of the root is the same as that of the present tense in the verbs beginning with ‘okāsa’, ‘okāsa’, ‘āhaṅi’, ‘ssena’, ‘saha’.

original: Labhavasacchidabhidarudānaṃ cchaṅi-.
analyzed: labha vasat chida bhida rudānam cchaṅi
translated: The form of the root is the same as that of the future tense in the verbs beginning with ‘labha’, ‘vasa’, ‘cchida’, ‘bhidara’, ‘rudana’, ‘ssena’, ‘saha’.

original: Labhādīnaṃ cchaṅi vā hoti ssena saha; alacchā, alabhissā, lacchati, labhissati; avacchā,🔽avasissā; vacchati, vasissati; cchecchā, acchindissā; checchati. Chindissati; hecchā,🔽bhindissā; bhecchati,bhindissati; arucchā, arodissā; rucchati, rodissati. Aññasmimpi
analyzed: labha ādīnam cchaṅi vā hoti ssena saha alacchā alabhissā lacchati labhissati avacchā  a vasissā vacchati vasissati cchecchā a chindissā checchati chindissati hecchā  bhindissā bhecchati bhindissati arucchā arodissā rucchati rodissati aññasmim pi
translated: The form of the root is the same as that of the future tense in the verbs beginning with ‘labha’, etc., in the 2nd person singular, or in the 3rd person singular.🔽The form of the root is the same as that of the present tense in the verbs beginning with ‘cchida’, ‘bhidara’, ‘rudana’, etc., in the 2nd person singular, or in the 3rd person singular.🔽The form of the root is the same as that of the future tense in the verbs beginning with ‘cchida’, ‘bhidara’, ‘rudana’, etc., in the 2nd person singular, or in the 3rd person singular.

original: chidassa vā cchaṅi yogavibhāgā?- Acchecchuṃ, acchindiṃsu. Aññesaṃ va?-Gacchaṃ, gacchissaṃ.
analyzed: chidassa vā cchaṅi yoga vibhāgāḥ acchecchum acchindiṃsu aññesam vagaccham gacchissam
translated: The form of the root is the same as that of the present tense in the verbs beginning with ‘cchida’, ‘bhidara’, ‘rudana’, etc., in the 2nd person singular, or in the 3rd person singular.🔽The form of the root is the same as that of the future tense in the verbs beginning with ‘cchida’, ‘bhidara’, ‘rudana’, etc., in the 2nd person singular, or in the 3rd person singular.

original: Bhujamucavacavisānaṃ kkhaṅi-.
analyzed: bhuja muca vaca visānam kkhaṅi
translated: The form of the root is the same as that of the present tense in the verbs beginning with ‘bhuja’, ‘muca’, ‘vac’, ‘visa’, etc., in the 2nd person singular, or in the 3rd person singular.

original: Bhujādīnaṃ kkhaṅi vā hoti ssena saha; abhokkhā, abhuñjissā; bhokkhati, bhujissati;🔽amokkhā, amuñcissā; mokkhatiṃ muñcissati; acakkhā, avacissā; cakkhati. Vacissati;
analyzed: bhuja ādīnam kkhaṅi vā hoti ssena saha abhokkhā abhuñjissā bhokkhati bhujissati  a mokkhā a muñcissā mokkhatim muñcissati a cakkhā a vacissā cakkhati vacissati
translated: The forms of bhuñj, etc., are bhokkhā, abhuñjissā, bhokkhati, bhuñjissati,🔽amokkhā, amuñcissā, mokkhati, muñcissati, acakkhā, avacissā, cakkhati, vacissati,

original: pāvekkhā, pāvisissā; pavekkhati, pavisissati. Visassāññasmimpi vā kkhaṅi yogavibhāgā?-Pāvekkhi, pāvisi.
analyzed: pāvekkhā pāvisissā pavekkhati pavisissati visassa aññasmin pi vā kkhaṅi yogavibhāgā pāvekkhi pāvisi
translated: The kkhaṅ of bhuj, etc., is optionally added to ss, as abhokkhā, abhuñjissā, bhokkhati, bhujissati; amokkhā, amuñcissā, mokkhati, muñcissati; acakkhā, avacissā, cakkhati, vacissati; pāvekkhā, pāvisissā, pavekkhati, pavisissati. Visassāññasmimpi vā kkhaṅi yogavibhāgā. Pāvekkhi, pāvisi.

original: Āīādisu harassā-.
analyzed: āī ādisu harassā
translated: Āīādisu harassā-.

original: Āādoīādo ca harassaā hoticā; ahā, aharā; abhāsi, abhari.
analyzed: ca harassaā hoticā ahā aharā abhāsi abhari
translated: The kkhaṅ of har is optionally added to āīādisu, as ahā, aharā; abhāsi, abhari.

original: Gamissa-.
analyzed: gamissa
translated: Gamissa-.

original: Āādoīādo ca gamissā hoti vā; agā, agamā; agā,agami. Saṃsassa ca chaṅi-.
analyzed: ca gamissā hoti vā agāḥ agamāḥ saṃsassa ca chaṅi
translated: Gamissa is optionally added to āīādisu, as agā, agamā; agā, agami. Saṃsassa ca chaṅi-.

original: Saṃsassa ca gamissa ca chaṅi vā hoti āīādisu; aḍañchā, aḍaṃsā; aḍañchi,aḍaṃsi; agañchā, agacchā, agañchi, agacchi.
analyzed: saṃsassa ca gamissa ca chaṅi vā hoti āī ādisu aḍañchā aḍaṃsā aḍañchi aḍaṃsi agañchā agacchā agañchi agacchi
translated: Saṃsassa and gamissa are optionally added to chaṅi in āīādisu, as aḍañchā, aḍaṃsā; aḍañchi, aḍaṃsi; agañchā, agacchā, agañchi, agacchi.

original: Hūssahehehihohī ssaccādo-.
analyzed: hūs sahe he hi ho hī s sac ca ādaḥ
translated: Hūssahehehihohī ssaccādo-.

original: Hūssa hñādayo honti ssaccādo; hessati, hehissati, hohissati.
analyzed: hūs sa hñ ādayaḥ honti hessati hehissati hohissati
translated: Hūssa hñādayo honti ssaccādo, hessati, hehissati, hohissati.

original: Ṇānāsu rasso-.
analyzed: ṇa a nāsu rassaḥ
translated: Ṇānāsu rasso-.

original: Kaṇakanāsu kriyatthassarasso hoti; kiṇāti, dhunāti.
analyzed: kaṇa kanāsu hoti kiṇāti dhunāti
translated: The rasso is added to kaṇakanāsu kriyatthā, as kiṇāti, dhunāti.

original: Āīūmhāssāssamhānaṃ vā-.
analyzed: vā
translated: The vowel of the first syllable is lengthened, or the vowel of the first syllable is lengthened and the vowel of the second syllable is shortened.🔽The vowel of the first syllable is lengthened, or the vowel of the first syllable is lengthened and the vowel of the second syllable is shortened.🔽The vowel of the first syllable is lengthened, or the vowel of the first syllable is lengthened and the vowel of the second syllable is shortened.

original: Esaṃ vā rasso hoti; gama, gamā; gami, gamī; gamu; gamimha, gamimhā; gamissa, gamissā; gamissamha, gamissamhā.🔽Kusaruhehissa chi-.🔽Kusā ruhā ca parassa īssa chi vā hoti; akkocchi, akkosi; abhirucchi, abhiruhi.
analyzed: vā rassaḥ hoti gama gamā gami gamī gamu gamimha gamimhā gamissa gamissā gamissamha gamissamhā  kusa ruhehissa chi  kusā ruhā ca parassa īssa chi vā hoti akkocchi akkosi abhirucchi abhiruhi
translated: The vowel of the first syllable is lengthened, or the vowel of the first syllable is lengthened and the vowel of the second syllable is shortened.🔽The vowel of the first syllable is lengthened, or the vowel of the first syllable is lengthened and the vowel of the second syllable is shortened.🔽The vowel of the first syllable is lengthened, or the vowel of the first syllable is lengthened and the vowel of the second syllable is shortened.🔽The vowel of the first syllable is lengthened, or the vowel of the first syllable is lengthened and the vowel of the second syllable is shortened.

original: Aīssaādīnaṃ byañjanassiña-.🔽Kriyatthā paresaṃ aādīnaṃ īādinaṃ ssaādīnava byañjanassैña hoti vibhāsā; babhuvittha,abhavittha,🔽abhavissā, anubhavissā, anubhavissati, anubhossati, (harissati) hassati. Etesanti

translated: The two beginning with ‘atthi’ and ‘atthi teyya’ have ‘siyā’ and ‘siyū’ respectively.🔽The ‘tho’ comes after ‘atthi’.

original: Atthito parassa takārassa tho hoti; attha, atthu.🔽Sihisvaṭa-.

translated: The ‘ṭa’ comes after ‘atthi’ in the ‘sihi’ group.🔽The ‘ṭa’ comes after the ‘atthi’ in the ‘sihi’ group.🔽The ‘mi’ and ‘mhi’ come after ‘atthi’.

original: Atthismā paresaṃ mimānaṃ mhimhā vā honti, taṃsantiyo gena tthissa aṭa ca; amhi,asmi; amha, asma.🔽Esu sa-.

translated: The ‘mi’ and ‘mhi’ come after ‘atthi’.🔽The ‘sa’ comes after ‘atthi’ in the ‘esu’ group.

original: Esu mimesuatthissa sakāro hoti; asmi, asma; pararūpabādhanatthaṃ.🔽Īādo dīgho-.🔽Atthissa dīgho hoti īādimhi; āsi, āsuṃ, āsi, āsittha, āsiṃ, āsimhā.

translated: The ‘sa’ comes after ‘atthi’ in the ‘esu’ group.🔽The ‘ī’ and so on are lengthened.🔽The ‘ī’ and so on are lengthened after ‘atthi’.🔽The ‘a’ is lengthened in ‘himi’ and so on.

original: Himimesvassa-. Akārassa dīgho hoti himimesu; pavāhi, pavāmi, pavāma; muyhāmi.🔽Sakā ṇāssa kha īādo-.🔽Sakasmā kaṇāssa kho hoti ī ādisu; asakkhi, asakkhiṃsu.

analyzed: an ākulam duladdhīhi pāpa bhikkhūhi sabbaso
translated: Unmixed with bad monks, difficult to be with,🔽

original: Laṅkāya munirājassa sāsanaṃ sādhu saṇṭhitaṃ,
analyzed: laṅkāya muni rājassa sāsanam sādhu saṇṭhitam
translated: The religion of the king of the Munis in Laṅkā was well established, free from all evil monks, and difficult to be understood by the ignorant.

original: Puṇṇavandasamāyogā vāridhīca vivaddhate;
analyzed: puṇṇa vanda samāyogāḥ
translated: The ocean of the water of the rain of the merit of Puṇṇavāsa increased.

original: Parakkamabhuje tasmiṃ saddhābuddhiguṇodite,
analyzed: parakkama bhuje tasmin saddhā buddhi guṇa udite
translated: In that Parakkamabāhu, in whom faith, understanding and virtues were increased,

original: Manuvaṃsaddhajākāre laṅkādīpaṃ pasāsati;
analyzed: laṅkā dīpam
translated: the banner of the Manu race, ruled the island of Laṅkā,

original: Māggallānena therena dhīmatā sucivuttinaṃ,🔽Racitaṃ yaṃ suviññeyyamasandiddhamanākulaṃ;🔽Asesavisayavyāpi jinavyappathanissayaṃ,
analyzed: māggallānena therena dhīmatā  racitam yam su viññeyyam asandiddham an ākulam
translated: the wise Thera Māgadha, who was well versed in the Vinaya,🔽composed this (commentary) which is easy to be understood, free from obscurity and confusion,🔽which extends over the whole field of the (Vinaya) and is based on the explanation of the Victorious One,

original: Saddasatthamanāyāsasādhiyaṃ buddhivaddhanaṃ;
analyzed: buddhivat dhanam
translated: which can be easily understood by the increase of the understanding, without any trouble,

original: Tassa vutti samāsena vipulatthappakāsanī,
analyzed: tassa vutti samāsena vipula attha ppakāsanī
translated: and which, in brief, teaches the extensive meaning of the (Vinaya).

original: Racitā puna teneva sāsanujjotakārināti;
analyzed: racitā puna tena iva
translated: It was composed again by him, the illuminator of the religion.
